commit_message:
Avoid installing etcd3 in subnodes

We need to handle this better, for now, just don't install
etcd in the sub nodes. We need to setup the proper clustering
mechanism if we want to have etcd3 running in multiple nodes

Change-Id: I8dd385e3c993942473e67d04367cdf74495dbeef

commit_message:
WIP: nova-powervm: Allow multiple volume attachments

Add multiattach support for the PowerVM driver, by setting the
virt driver capability 'support_multiattach' to true.

Change-Id: I66208996b35f9e76ffc85a6a445427e2dfcad5d4
Partially-implements: blueprint multi-attach-volume

revisions:
[{'number': 33, 'created': '2017-05-22 21:57:48.000000000', 'files': ['unstack.sh', 'stackrc', 'lib/etcd3', 'stack.sh'], 'message': 'etcd3 as a base service

ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL is set to github url, in our CI, we can point
ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL to a url in tarballs.openstack.org possibly
in devstack-gate

Download the etcd binaries and drop them into /opt/stack/bin and
use it from there. Cache the tgz for subsequent use (local workflow)

daemon-reload is called twice once from inside the write_user_unit_file
and then when we adjust the entries with additional things recommended
by the etcd team. We need a better way to do this in the future.

Added a TODO to verify the downloaded artifact later. The etcd team
posts gpg signature, we could verify that or run sha256sum and hard
code that in lib/etcd3 file. We would have to update it whenever we
bump the etcd3 version.

We use the public key "CoreOS Application Signing Key <security@coreos.com>"
with ID FC8A365E to verify the integrity of the downloaded file

Any jobs that need to be run on architectures where v3.1.7 is not available
should rey the v3.2.0-rcX release candidates. We can switch to v3.2.0
when it gets released.

Initial version of this code was borrowed from the dragonflow
repo:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/dragonflow/tree/devstack

Change-Id: Ibbb430fb1dbf66942168e0cb52d990ab6a2eb8d7
'}]
commit_message:
etcd3 as a base service

ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL is set to github url, in our CI, we can point
ETCD_DOWNLOAD_URL to a url in tarballs.openstack.org possibly
in devstack-gate

Download the etcd binaries and drop them into /opt/stack/bin and
use it from there. Cache the tgz for subsequent use (local workflow)

daemon-reload is called twice once from inside the write_user_unit_file
and then when we adjust the entries with additional things recommended
by the etcd team. We need a better way to do this in the future.

Added a TODO to verify the downloaded artifact later. The etcd team
posts gpg signature, we could verify that or run sha256sum and hard
code that in lib/etcd3 file. We would have to update it whenever we
bump the etcd3 version.

We use the public key "CoreOS Application Signing Key <security@coreos.com>"
with ID FC8A365E to verify the integrity of the downloaded file

Any jobs that need to be run on architectures where v3.1.7 is not available
should rey the v3.2.0-rcX release candidates. We can switch to v3.2.0
when it gets released.

Initial version of this code was borrowed from the dragonflow
repo:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/dragonflow/tree/devstack

Change-Id: Ibbb430fb1dbf66942168e0cb52d990ab6a2eb8d7

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-19 13:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['reference/new-projects-requirements.rst'], 'message': 'Stop requiring public IRC meetings

As we look at alternatives to regular IRC meetings, lets move the
requirement for meetings.

To smooth the transition we keep the requirement that if any meetings
happen they are kept open.

Change-Id: I3242d256aeea75183acf9f848fbf1526d099ac87
'}]
commit_message:
Stop requiring public IRC meetings

As we look at alternatives to regular IRC meetings, lets move the
requirement for meetings.

To smooth the transition we keep the requirement that if any meetings
happen they are kept open.

Change-Id: I3242d256aeea75183acf9f848fbf1526d099ac87

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-22 17:16:08.000000000', 'files': ['reference/tags/assert_never-breaks-compat.rst'], 'message': 'Add tag assert:never-breaks-compat

As a more extreme compatibility promise past
assert:follows-standard-deprecation, some projects choose to assert that
they commit to their API until the end of time. Make a tag that formally
asserts that promise.

Change-Id: If8c87ea2876facd2c407c2b256e556148c069777
'}]
commit_message:
Add tag assert:never-breaks-compat

As a more extreme compatibility promise past
assert:follows-standard-deprecation, some projects choose to assert that
they commit to their API until the end of time. Make a tag that formally
asserts that promise.

Change-Id: If8c87ea2876facd2c407c2b256e556148c069777

commit_message:
Delete internal ports when detach them

Make sure only to delete internal ports when user
wants to detach them, and just do detach for
external ports.

Closes-Bug: #1676821
(cherry picked from commit b194775ebeaf75a88e6b0b9623aa602cb8c32e0c)

Support 'list_concat_unique'

and make sure without repeating items.

commit_message:
Remove undefined variable in exception message

In case of container format and disk format don’t match and the
container format is one of ami, ari, aki UnboundLocalError will
be raised since disk_format variable in the exception message
isn’t defined.

Change-Id: Ibe44317a2750ed29d72928f72f909f037169f1b1

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-04-01 23:41:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_firewall.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py'], 'message': 'Avoid deleting other agents' iptables rules

duplicates - as revealed by logs like these from the DHCP agent:

2017-02-02 18:50:29.482 3376 WARNING neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager [-] Duplicate iptables rule detected. This may indicate a bug in the iptables rule generation code. Line: -A felix-to-ebf1bc0b-ba -m mark --mark 0x1000000/0x1000000 -m comment --comment "Profile accepted packet" -j RETURN
2017-02-02 18:50:29.483 3376 WARNING neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager [-] Duplicate iptables rule detected. This may indicate a bug in the iptables rule generation code. Line: -A felix-to-3d959cf9-36 -m mark --mark 0x1000000/0x1000000 -m comment --comment "Profile accepted packet" -j RETURN
2017-02-02 18:50:29.483 3376 WARNING neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager [-] Duplicate iptables rule detected. This may indicate a bug in the iptables rule generation code. Line: -A felix-from-ebf1bc0b-ba -m mark --mark 0x1000000/0x1000000 -m comment --comment "Profile accepted packet" -j RETURN
2017-02-02 18:50:29.483 3376 WARNING neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager [-] Duplicate iptables rule detected. This may indicate a bug in the iptables rule generation code. Line: -A felix-from-3d959cf9-36 -m mark --mark 0x1000000/0x1000000 -m comment --comment "Profile accepted packet" -j RETURN

removed, and thereby breaks Calico's iptables.

The removal of the 'duplicates' is done by a function that was marked
for removal anyway, and discussion with kevinbenton has confirmed that

function.

Change-Id: I35ad2c1bb9dd5eb143e9bf47642586c16dd2aea7
Closes-Bug: #1664782
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid deleting other agents' iptables rules

Calico's Felix agent generates iptables chains that intentionally
include rules that the Neutron iptables_manager code considers to be
duplicates - as revealed by logs like these from the DHCP agent:

2017-02-02 18:50:29.482 3376 WARNING neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager [-] Duplicate iptables rule detected. This may indicate a bug in the iptables rule generation code. Line: -A felix-to-ebf1bc0b-ba -m mark --mark 0x1000000/0x1000000 -m comment --comment "Profile accepted packet" -j RETURN
2017-02-02 18:50:29.483 3376 WARNING neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager [-] Duplicate iptables rule detected. This may indicate a bug in the iptables rule generation code. Line: -A felix-to-3d959cf9-36 -m mark --mark 0x1000000/0x1000000 -m comment --comment "Profile accepted packet" -j RETURN
2017-02-02 18:50:29.483 3376 WARNING neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager [-] Duplicate iptables rule detected. This may indicate a bug in the iptables rule generation code. Line: -A felix-from-ebf1bc0b-ba -m mark --mark 0x1000000/0x1000000 -m comment --comment "Profile accepted packet" -j RETURN
2017-02-02 18:50:29.483 3376 WARNING neutron.agent.linux.iptables_manager [-] Duplicate iptables rule detected. This may indicate a bug in the iptables rule generation code. Line: -A felix-from-3d959cf9-36 -m mark --mark 0x1000000/0x1000000 -m comment --comment "Profile accepted packet" -j RETURN

IIUC, iptables_manager then reprograms iptables with these 'duplicates'
removed, and thereby breaks Calico's iptables.

The removal of the 'duplicates' is done by a function that was marked
for removal anyway, and discussion with kevinbenton has confirmed that
it should be removed now.  So we solve the problem by removing that
function.

Change-Id: I35ad2c1bb9dd5eb143e9bf47642586c16dd2aea7
Closes-Bug: #1664782

commit_message:
Optimise CentOS repo configuration in nodepool

The RDO repositories in OpenStack-CI are reverse proxied
in order to improve test performance. This patch uses a
dyanmic include to seperate the needs of each package
manager for testing and to optimise the configuration
for OpenStack-CI.

Change-Id: Ibe5e19cc18cfe29f821d4684c866e8dd750d6ff8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 16:57:57.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/cells.rst'], 'message': "doc: add cells v2 FAQ on mapping instances

This came up in IRC where someone upgraded from newton to
ocata and didn't use the simple_cell_setup command, but they
didn't run the map_instances command. Our cells v2 deploy/upgrade
guide mentions using simple_cell_setup for the minimal scenario
so it wasn't clear that they needed to run map_instances.

The install guide doesn't mention any of this either since this
is about upgrades, and the install guide is focused on fresh installs
where there are no existing instances to map.

Change-Id: Iedf3aabf1508abf59a54071b20a7f1c58b63e32c
"}]
commit_message:
doc: add cells v2 FAQ on mapping instances

This came up in IRC where someone upgraded from newton to
ocata and didn't use the simple_cell_setup command, but they
didn't run the map_instances command. Our cells v2 deploy/upgrade
guide mentions using simple_cell_setup for the minimal scenario
so it wasn't clear that they needed to run map_instances.

The install guide doesn't mention any of this either since this
is about upgrades, and the install guide is focused on fresh installs
where there are no existing instances to map.

Change-Id: Iedf3aabf1508abf59a54071b20a7f1c58b63e32c

commit_message:
Authentication type for peers should be support to update.

When updating authentication type for this peer, it must delete
and configure this peer with parameter "auth-type" again.
It is not reasonable for updating authentication type for in the way.
If updating authentication type for this peer, it should use the command
"neutron bgp-peer-update".

Change-Id: Ie040a11221a4ef0fbd47452fe3c11b03b39048e0

commit_message:
Add test case for showing service catalog

Tempest now doesn't contain show service catalog api in identity client,
either the relevant tests. This patch is to add the support.

Including:

[1] Add show service catalog to v3 identity_client
[2] Add unit tests for show service catalog
[3] Add test case: test_show_service_catalog
[4] Add release note

Change-Id: I2d66e6c6aab6c95903f105d0be73d15b0760dcab

commit_message:
Fix duplicating <network_entity>_list() calls in api.network

The solution is trivial - to add @memoize decorator to the following
calls:
* api.neutron.subnet_list
* api.neutron.port_list
* api.network.tenant_floating_ip_list
* api.network.security_group_list

Closes-Bug: #1592940
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Change-Id: Ibc0d227e07adfcc18bd2d0ed114d1da0f4ff04ad

Authentication type for peers should be support to update.

When updating authentication type for this peer, it must delete
and configure this peer with parameter "auth-type" again.
It is not reasonable for updating authentication type for in the way.

"neutron bgp-peer-update".

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 15:30:28.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py'], 'message': "Fix fetching VHD images from Glance

As per a recent change, the source image format is explicitly
specified when converting images fetched from Glance.

The issue is that qemu-img still uses the legacy 'vpc' name for the
vhd format. For this reason, trying to convert a vhd image will fail
as qemu-img does not recognize the format, expecting 'vpc' instead.

This change fixes this issue, checking the source image format,
using 'vpc' when converting VHD images.

Change-Id: Ia03f4ae70d3b2da37da6d0bfc4a939080c66c306
Closes-Bug: #1692938
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fetching VHD images from Glance

As per a recent change, the source image format is explicitly
specified when converting images fetched from Glance.

The issue is that qemu-img still uses the legacy 'vpc' name for the
vhd format. For this reason, trying to convert a vhd image will fail
as qemu-img does not recognize the format, expecting 'vpc' instead.

This change fixes this issue, checking the source image format,
using 'vpc' when converting VHD images.

Change-Id: Ia03f4ae70d3b2da37da6d0bfc4a939080c66c306
Closes-Bug: #1692938

Change-Id: I2439de036dfec2ada3c92c2d4b71c73b5f41a518
(cherry picked from commit 34efcdfcafad3108e54fd4351a414f3a74e1ef6f)

commit_message:
Use 'virt_type=kvm' in devstack vm if supported

If the devstack vm supports nested virtualization we should
use it.
This can done using by setting: DEVSTACK_GATE_LIBVIRT_TYPE=kvm.
This will increase the performance in gate jobs.

Change-Id: I2439de036dfec2ada3c92c2d4b71c73b5f41a518
(cherry picked from commit 34efcdfcafad3108e54fd4351a414f3a74e1ef6f)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-23 16:56:55.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/run-tarball.sh', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/scripts/run-wheel.sh', 'jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Separate Puppet OpenStack tarball jobs from Python jobs

Because Puppet OpenStack modules require specific logics and packages to
be released and archived, we think it's better to separate the jobs that
create tarballs from Python jobs.

This patch:
* Create a job-template "{name}-puppet-tarball" with all required logic
  to create tarballs from Puppet modules.
* Create a job-group "puppet-release-jobs" which contains
  "{name}-puppet-tarball" and other regular release jobs. (It replaced
  "{name}-tarball").
* Use the new jobgroup for all Puppet OpenStack modules.
* Move {name}-branch-tarball into the new job-template.
* Remove Puppet logic in scripts/run-tarball.sh and jenkins/scripts/run-wheel.sh
  which is not needed anymore.
* Create a new Zuul layout called "puppet-release-jobs" which contains
  the jobs needed to release Puppet OpenStack modules.
* Use the new layout for all Puppet OpenStack modules.
* Remove puppet-branch-tarball-jobs layout and move the {name}-branch-tarball job
  into the new layout.

Change-Id: Idb3811bae16321717e5e5467fc3c56492ed57520
'}]
commit_message:
Separate Puppet OpenStack tarball jobs from Python jobs

Because Puppet OpenStack modules require specific logics and packages to
be released and archived, we think it's better to separate the jobs that
create tarballs from Python jobs.

This patch:
* Create a job-template "{name}-puppet-tarball" with all required logic
  to create tarballs from Puppet modules.
* Create a job-group "puppet-release-jobs" which contains
  "{name}-puppet-tarball" and other regular release jobs. (It replaced
  "{name}-tarball").
* Use the new jobgroup for all Puppet OpenStack modules.
* Move {name}-branch-tarball into the new job-template.
* Remove Puppet logic in scripts/run-tarball.sh and jenkins/scripts/run-wheel.sh
  which is not needed anymore.
* Create a new Zuul layout called "puppet-release-jobs" which contains
  the jobs needed to release Puppet OpenStack modules.
* Use the new layout for all Puppet OpenStack modules.
* Remove puppet-branch-tarball-jobs layout and move the {name}-branch-tarball job
  into the new layout.

Change-Id: Idb3811bae16321717e5e5467fc3c56492ed57520

subject: Set manifest permissions in the image
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-24 05:21:31.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/manifests/cleanup.d/01-copy-manifests-dir'], 'message': "Set manifest permissions in the image

This is a follow-on to 57ef187632c97eb7c2f27207c19f11336b28d97c.

There's two things going on here; DIB_MANIFEST_IMAGE_DIR is *outside*
the chroot on the build host.  We copy the files here for posterity, I
guess.  MANIFEST_IMAGE_PATH is *inside* the chroot and are the files
we want to ensure are locked to root.

The prior change modified the permissions on DIB_MANIFEST_IMAGE_DIR.
So the first time you build, it works -- then the second time,
assuming you're using the same output filename, it hits the root-owned
manifest directories and causes a build failure.

I have built with this and checked that the manifest files in the
image are locked to root:

 $ virt-ls -a ./test.qcow2 -l /etc/dib-manifests
 total 32
 drwxr-xr-x  2 0 0  4096 May 24 03:39 .
 drwxr-xr-x 53 0 0  4096 May 24 03:39 ..
 -rw-------  1 0 0 15236 May 24 03:39 dib-manifest-dpkg-test
 -rw-------  1 0 0    35 May 24 03:39 dib_arguments
 -rw-------  1 0 0   137 May 24 03:39 dib_environment

Related-Bug: #1671842
Change-Id: I08319d0b5fcc461d40fe0be8427dcf0e37ad21e6
"}]
commit_message:
Set manifest permissions in the image

This is a follow-on to 57ef187632c97eb7c2f27207c19f11336b28d97c.

There's two things going on here; DIB_MANIFEST_IMAGE_DIR is *outside*
the chroot on the build host.  We copy the files here for posterity, I
guess.  MANIFEST_IMAGE_PATH is *inside* the chroot and are the files
we want to ensure are locked to root.

The prior change modified the permissions on DIB_MANIFEST_IMAGE_DIR.
So the first time you build, it works -- then the second time,
assuming you're using the same output filename, it hits the root-owned
manifest directories and causes a build failure.

I have built with this and checked that the manifest files in the
image are locked to root:

 $ virt-ls -a ./test.qcow2 -l /etc/dib-manifests
 total 32
 drwxr-xr-x  2 0 0  4096 May 24 03:39 .

 -rw-------  1 0 0 15236 May 24 03:39 dib-manifest-dpkg-test

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 15100, 'name': 'zhongjun', 'email': 'jun.zhongjun2@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhongjun2'}, {'_account_id': 15942, 'name': 'Dell EMC Isilon CI', 'email': 'emc.isilon.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'e', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16657, 'name': 'Huawei Manila CI', 'email': 'huawei-manila-ci@huawei.com', 'username': 'huawei-manila-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18128, 'name': 'Microsoft Manila CI', 'email': 'Microsoft_Manila_CI@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_manila_ci'}, {'_account_id': 21884, 'name': 'DellEMC Unity CI', 'email': 'emc.unity.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-unity-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-25 06:24:05.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/dell_emc/plugins/unity/connection.py'], 'message': 'Dell Unity: failed to get share server

In Dell EMC Unity Manila driver, when the required option
`unity_server_meta_pool` is not configured. It failed with exception
"failed to get share server" and "UnityPoolList is not JSON
serializable" when creating share.

This fix enhances the driver. When the required options are not
configured, the driver would fail to start up.

Change-Id: I2072501ce0203f4a60b0fb6627ce53362598f4e8
Closes-Bug: 1686007
'}]
commit_message:
Dell Unity: failed to get share server

In Dell EMC Unity Manila driver, when the required option
`unity_server_meta_pool` is not configured. It failed with exception
"failed to get share server" and "UnityPoolList is not JSON
serializable" when creating share.

This fix enhances the driver. When the required options are not
configured, the driver would fail to start up.

Change-Id: I2072501ce0203f4a60b0fb6627ce53362598f4e8
Closes-Bug: 1686007

commit_message:
Add API documentation for force-delete volume in v2 and v3.

There is no API doc found for force-delete volume in cinder.
We need to add the API doc for the operation with its description,
request and response parameters.

Change-Id: Id25b4070a3946d2d7d89f44bdc81039286a5d8fe
Closes-bug: #1673644

commit_message:
Make target_cell() yield a new context

This makes target_cell() do the thing it was originally intended to do,
which is yield a new context that is targeted at the proper cell. With this,
any objects you create inside the target context manager (assuming you use
the yielded context) will remain targeted after the thing returns.

Related to blueprint cells-aware-api

Change-Id: Iccdf6b80f5fc8adcc8a89ce6ece3f37b6cbcaee2

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2017-05-23 15:15:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cmd/status.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_server_groups.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/consoleauth/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_host_api.py', 'nova/objects/host_mapping.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_connection_switch.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/server_external_events.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/server_tags.py', 'nova/scheduler/ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/api/metadata/base.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "Move to proper target_cell calling convention

When target_cell was originally written, the intent was to yield the
context that should be used. It currently mutates the input context,
which means you don't have to actually use the yielded one, because
we have a lot of stuff that would break otherwise. This fixes all the
current uses of it to be proper, and adjusts tests accordingly. This
is separate from changing target_cell's behavior to not mutate the
input context specifically to isolate the mechanical changes from ones
that actually need different behavior.

In addition to code that was already using target_cell() but not
depending on the yielded context, the _create_block_device_mapping()
method in conductor/manager.py was still depending on the shared
context switching to target the BDM objects on create. Since these
were prepared with the context prior to having determined where the
instanace was going to end up, we need to explicitly target the
object context on create (like the rest of the boot workflow does
for other objects in schedule_and_build_instances()).

Related to blueprint cells-aware-api

Change-Id: I35206e665f2c81531a2269dd66f8c5c0df834245
"}]
commit_message:
Move to proper target_cell calling convention

When target_cell was originally written, the intent was to yield the
context that should be used. It currently mutates the input context,
which means you don't have to actually use the yielded one, because
we have a lot of stuff that would break otherwise. This fixes all the
current uses of it to be proper, and adjusts tests accordingly. This
is separate from changing target_cell's behavior to not mutate the
input context specifically to isolate the mechanical changes from ones
that actually need different behavior.

In addition to code that was already using target_cell() but not
depending on the yielded context, the _create_block_device_mapping()
method in conductor/manager.py was still depending on the shared
context switching to target the BDM objects on create. Since these
were prepared with the context prior to having determined where the
instanace was going to end up, we need to explicitly target the
object context on create (like the rest of the boot workflow does
for other objects in schedule_and_build_instances()).

Related to blueprint cells-aware-api

Change-Id: I35206e665f2c81531a2269dd66f8c5c0df834245

commit_message:
New readonly panel for trunks

Enable display of trunks on the project dashboard.

To test it devstack needs to have neutron with trunk support, eg:

 local.conf:
 enable_plugin neutron https://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron
 enable_service q-trunk

No special horizon config is needed. As long as the 'trunk'
API extension is available (openstack extension show trunk)
the panel should automatically appear under Project/Network/Trunks.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bence Romsics <bence.romsics@ericsson.com>
Change-Id: Iacb83f22f81e09457953622e61065f0bb2c27407
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui

subject: Switch to using "partition" objects
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-05-20 09:11:09.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/vm/block-device-ppc.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/level1/partition.py', 'diskimage_builder/elements/vm/block-device-default.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/blockdevice.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/level1/partitioning.py'], 'message': 'Switch to using "partition" objects

This switches to using a list of "partition" objects to describe the
partition layout.  This means that the special-case handling of the
"partitions:" key in the "partitioning" type is no longer required.

The partitions to create are found by the "partitioning" object at
create() time.

The "partition" objects no longer do anything in create() ... they
just let the parent object find it.

Change-Id: Ib7fd394139f5a70fa64f61e8bbd1d6bbca470bcf
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to using "partition" objects

This switches to using a list of "partition" objects to describe the
partition layout.  This means that the special-case handling of the
"partitions:" key in the "partitioning" type is no longer required.

The partitions to create are found by the "partitioning" object at
create() time.

The "partition" objects no longer do anything in create() ... they
just let the parent object find it.

Change-Id: Ib7fd394139f5a70fa64f61e8bbd1d6bbca470bcf

When protection plugin restores resources by itself not by Heat,

Implements: blueprint remove-heat

commit_message:
Add requires parameter of 'restore'

When protection plugin restores resources by itself not by Heat,
it needs update the restore status of resource at the time that
it starts and finishes restoring resource. Besides, the status
is stored in DB. So, a requires parameter of 'restore' is needed
for each task.

Change-Id: I419151c63ada5d766cb565d4eb7961c733ec8aa9
Implements: blueprint remove-heat

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-24 01:49:24.000000000', 'files': ['zun/tests/unit/image/docker/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Tests: make test_pull_image_exception reasonable

The original way raising an errors.APIError won't execute the
code `except Exception e`, as the tested code is like this:

```python
except errors.APIError as api_error:
    raise exception.ZunException(str(api_error))
except Exception as e:
    msg = _('Cannot download image from docker: {0}')
    raise exception.ZunException(msg.format(e))
```

Change-Id: I95a1a650bc611f61ac03eb5fdf08481c67bb9ab7
"}]
commit_message:
Tests: make test_pull_image_exception reasonable

The original way raising an errors.APIError won't execute the
code `except Exception e`, as the tested code is like this:

```python
except errors.APIError as api_error:
    raise exception.ZunException(str(api_error))
except Exception as e:
    msg = _('Cannot download image from docker: {0}')
    raise exception.ZunException(msg.format(e))
```

Change-Id: I95a1a650bc611f61ac03eb5fdf08481c67bb9ab7

subject: Set global_request_id if passed in as X-OpenStack-Request-ID.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-23 16:48:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/tests/test_request_id.py', 'oslo_middleware/request_id.py', 'releasenotes/notes/global_request_id-a8ec7260fbd76444.yaml'], 'message': "Set global_request_id if passed in as X-OpenStack-Request-ID.

If an inbound header that validates against the regex ``req-$uuid`` is
passed in, we'll set it where oslo.context could later read it. This

Change-Id: I5c5268e8680392395fbe04efe0124575ad8db468

commit_message:
Set global_request_id if passed in as X-OpenStack-Request-ID.

If an inbound header that validates against the regex ``req-$uuid`` is
passed in, we'll set it where oslo.context could later read it. This
creates a mechanism for parents to pass their request-id to children.

Change-Id: I5c5268e8680392395fbe04efe0124575ad8db468

subject: Allow compatibility headers for request_id
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-23 16:48:47.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/compat_headers-55a635b8ec01b6f1.yaml', 'oslo_middleware/tests/test_request_id.py', 'oslo_middleware/request_id.py'], 'message': "Allow compatibility headers for request_id

We discovered that Nova is using a local version of the request_id
header code because it's x-compute-request-id predates
x-openstack-request-id, and things were never migrated after the oslo
code was extracted. In order to let Nova use the base code (which may
become more complicated with inbound request-id setting) we need to
support a compat headers field, which is additional http header names
that should be set with the request-id value.

Change-Id: I18a92f8bf2f85fcf30d32be68bae58f64b135df0
"}]
commit_message:
Allow compatibility headers for request_id

We discovered that Nova is using a local version of the request_id
header code because it's x-compute-request-id predates
x-openstack-request-id, and things were never migrated after the oslo
code was extracted. In order to let Nova use the base code (which may
become more complicated with inbound request-id setting) we need to
support a compat headers field, which is additional http header names
that should be set with the request-id value.

Change-Id: I18a92f8bf2f85fcf30d32be68bae58f64b135df0

Close-Bug: #1688175

commit_message:
Add resource claim for zun.

Add resource claim when create container and resource tracker to
update periodically. Now only track and claim memory and cpu
resource.

The following work need to do:
1, Remove claim resource when delete container.
2, Track the numa of compute node.
3, Filter scheduler set the Claim limits.
4, Handle the inventory and allocation.

Change-Id: I54199742921ce71b58f23d968a966d4b269f51ef
Close-Bug: #1688175
Partially-Implements: blueprint resource-claim

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-05-17 05:22:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example).
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.
If we didn't setup this variable, the default action will be not
showing any python deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I78d1c68e51ee0833fd1ff0e9548c41bb9d1239a8
"}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example).
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.
If we didn't setup this variable, the default action will be not
showing any python deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I78d1c68e51ee0833fd1ff0e9548c41bb9d1239a8

subject: Neutron chart: add tunnel types, bridge mappings and default interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-05-23 16:54:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/templates/bin/_openvswitch-ensure-configured.sh.tpl', 'neutron/templates/bin/_openvswitch-vswitchd.sh.tpl', 'neutron/values.yaml', 'neutron/templates/bin/_neutron-openvswitch-agent.sh.tpl'], 'message': "Neutron chart: add tunnel types, bridge mappings and default interfaces

Correction of tunnel_types config option in values.yaml, regarding the
_openvswitch_agent.ini.tpl layout.
Added bridge mappings, since it was lost with auto-generate configs.

Removed br-physnet1 and physnet1 in favor of 'external' network config.

Removed default network interface, replacing it with search for interface
with default gateway for tunneling. The interface for external bridge
has to be defined explicitly, otherwise no interface will be added to
external bridge automatically.
In OVS configuration scripts, added handling null port passed.

Change-Id: I90ebe222323b3b1ec8d20a8038c0dfed3de9b58c
Closes-Bug: #1686365
Closes-Bug: #1686367
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron chart: add tunnel types, bridge mappings and default interfaces

Correction of tunnel_types config option in values.yaml, regarding the
_openvswitch_agent.ini.tpl layout.
Added bridge mappings, since it was lost with auto-generate configs.

Removed br-physnet1 and physnet1 in favor of 'external' network config.

Removed default network interface, replacing it with search for interface
with default gateway for tunneling. The interface for external bridge
has to be defined explicitly, otherwise no interface will be added to
external bridge automatically.
In OVS configuration scripts, added handling null port passed.

Change-Id: I90ebe222323b3b1ec8d20a8038c0dfed3de9b58c
Closes-Bug: #1686365
Closes-Bug: #1686367

commit_message:
Add FATAL log level

Python logging library does not have FATAL logging level.
Added in same fashion like TRACE level.

Change-Id: Ibc11ccef56e997baea0094806d250292e72e3133

commit_message:
Fix validate() of rbac resource

Rbac can not be create if property 'object_id' is
reference with other resource, a validation error
raised when the reference resource not created yet.
This change will fix that.

Change-Id: I30c1cbf139ef1e94cc168730750e5af03d55d957
Closes-Bug: #1691355

subject: Rename driver to support different versions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 12024, 'name': 'Tong Liu', 'email': 'tongl@vmware.com', 'username': 'tong101'}, {'_account_id': 13438, 'name': 'Kobi Samoray', 'email': 'ksamoray@vmware.com', 'username': 'ksamoray'}, {'_account_id': 17734, 'name': 'Shih-Hao Li', 'email': 'shihli@vmware.com', 'username': 'shli'}, {'_account_id': 20363, 'name': 'Adit Sarfaty', 'email': 'asarfaty@vmware.com', 'username': 'asarfaty'}]
revisions:

Rename nsxv_driver to more genenric name lbv2_driver to support
different version of vmware drivers (e.g. nsx_v, nsx_v3).

Depends-on: I994d39a5dbdb38e1b7805b2eec97e8ef7719f556
Change-Id: I7308035d38f2ab15a85096ec30388ef5c3f56ca3
'}]
commit_message:
Rename driver to support different versions

Rename nsxv_driver to more genenric name lbv2_driver to support
different version of vmware drivers (e.g. nsx_v, nsx_v3).

commit_message:
Refactor neutron constraints

This changes:
1. remove the implemention of NetworkConstraint, just
   inherit from the super class NeutronConstraint;
2. remove the attribute 'cmd_resource' for neutron
   constraints, and resolve the 'cmd_resource' in
   find_resourceid_by_name_or_id()

Change-Id: I53ec9382a2e42c1a2742735bf15040c9db00f0cc

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 7979, 'name': 'Mikhail S Medvedev', 'email': 'mihailmed@gmail.com', 'username': 'msmedved'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-22 17:06:41.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Specify etcd download location for all CI jobs

In Ibbb430fb1dbf66942168e0cb52d990ab6a2eb8d7 change for devstack,
we download etcd from github for end user scenarios. However this
is not acceptable for our CI. So we need to set the environment
variable for devstack to something in our CI infrastructure. We
need to do this such that it is available to all jobs as etcd
will run for all jobs from now on.

NOTE: We can get rid of the wget in devstack when the distro(s)
package etcd 3.x for general use.

Change-Id: If06731ed540072e78e7fceacf4ebf650ed89f3ea
'}]
commit_message:
Specify etcd download location for all CI jobs

In Ibbb430fb1dbf66942168e0cb52d990ab6a2eb8d7 change for devstack,
we download etcd from github for end user scenarios. However this
is not acceptable for our CI. So we need to set the environment
variable for devstack to something in our CI infrastructure. We
need to do this such that it is available to all jobs as etcd
will run for all jobs from now on.

NOTE: We can get rid of the wget in devstack when the distro(s)
package etcd 3.x for general use.

Change-Id: If06731ed540072e78e7fceacf4ebf650ed89f3ea

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded libvirt default network iptalbes rules

The hardcoded libvirt default networks rulse should be removed.
They can cause issues if the 192.168.122.0 network exists in an
environment that is not libvirt.

If removing this breaks quickstart or CI, the libvirt fix should
be implemetned elsewhere.

Change-Id: I7e59ee723a3205bfcd311c95de2ecf44d016505d
Closes-Bug: #1690811

subject: Revert "Use interface not endpoint_type for keystoneclient"
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-13 08:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/cloud_config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_cloud_config.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Use interface not endpoint_type for keystoneclient"

This reverts commit 38e5eba621e48d74c05315da2b89e6c801f4c43f.

This patch introduced a bug when using Keystone v2. With this patch, the
following works:

python -c "import os_client_config; print(os_client_config.make_client('identity', auth_url='http://localhost/identity_admin', username='admin', project_name='admin', password='testtest', identity_api_version='3').roles.list())"

But changing identity_api_version from 3 to 2.0 raises an exception.

Without this patch, both 3 and 2.0 works.

Change-Id: I8d2ad71ff51a08af1166d36805b740ea272939ed
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use interface not endpoint_type for keystoneclient"

This reverts commit 38e5eba621e48d74c05315da2b89e6c801f4c43f.

This patch introduced a bug when using Keystone v2. With this patch, the
following works:

python -c "import os_client_config; print(os_client_config.make_client('identity', auth_url='http://localhost/identity_admin', username='admin', project_name='admin', password='testtest', identity_api_version='3').roles.list())"

But changing identity_api_version from 3 to 2.0 raises an exception.

Without this patch, both 3 and 2.0 works.

Change-Id: I8d2ad71ff51a08af1166d36805b740ea272939ed

subject: Send both gratuitous ARP REQUESTs and REPLYs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20330, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Networking CI', 'email': 'microsoft_neutron_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_neutron_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-18 18:09:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py'], 'message': 'Send both gratuitous ARP REQUESTs and REPLYs

Due to a linux kernel bug [1], network peers risk missing a gratuitous
arp update. This can be safely worked around by enabling arp_accept for
network interfaces that may receive those ARP packets [2]. Sadly, due to
another kernel bug [3], gratuitous ARP packets that we send are not
honoured by arp_accept. If we switch from REPLY to REQUEST packets, then
all recent kernels should enforce ARP table entry override on gARP
received.

REPLYs are left for backwards compatibility in case some network peers
honor REPLYs and not REQUESTs.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/760372/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1456272
[3] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/760373/

Related-Bug: #1690165
Change-Id: Iacd01875bf1299ff68fb5d1009d72088270320bb
'}]
commit_message:
Send both gratuitous ARP REQUESTs and REPLYs

Due to a linux kernel bug [1], network peers risk missing a gratuitous
arp update. This can be safely worked around by enabling arp_accept for
network interfaces that may receive those ARP packets [2]. Sadly, due to
another kernel bug [3], gratuitous ARP packets that we send are not
honoured by arp_accept. If we switch from REPLY to REQUEST packets, then
all recent kernels should enforce ARP table entry override on gARP
received.

REPLYs are left for backwards compatibility in case some network peers
honor REPLYs and not REQUESTs.

[1] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/760372/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1456272
[3] https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/760373/

Related-Bug: #1690165
Change-Id: Iacd01875bf1299ff68fb5d1009d72088270320bb

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-23 19:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/compute-usage-defaults-5f5b2936f17ff400.yaml', 'requirements.txt', 'shade/operatorcloud.py'], 'message': "Allow a user to submit start and end time as strings

get_compute_usage currently requires a user to provide a datetime
object. That's actually fairly unfriendly. Also, it turns out if you
happen to produce one of those with timezone offset information, Nova
will return a 400 error. It's pretty easy to convert a datetime with
timezone info to a datetime in UTC without it - so do that first.

Now a user can submit a fully compliant ISO 8601 datetime with whatever
info they want and we'll make it meet nova's standards. They can also
supply a datetime if they prefer.

Also - do date parsing before project get - to avoid an API call if the
validation that doesn't need an API call fails.

Finally, supply a default for 'start' of the first day OpenStack
existed.

Change-Id: I53989d47f0d24695c19c1023e35acb315bec9eea
"}]
commit_message:
Allow a user to submit start and end time as strings

get_compute_usage currently requires a user to provide a datetime
object. That's actually fairly unfriendly. Also, it turns out if you
happen to produce one of those with timezone offset information, Nova
will return a 400 error. It's pretty easy to convert a datetime with
timezone info to a datetime in UTC without it - so do that first.

Now a user can submit a fully compliant ISO 8601 datetime with whatever
info they want and we'll make it meet nova's standards. They can also
supply a datetime if they prefer.

Also - do date parsing before project get - to avoid an API call if the
validation that doesn't need an API call fails.

Finally, supply a default for 'start' of the first day OpenStack
existed.

Change-Id: I53989d47f0d24695c19c1023e35acb315bec9eea

Warn instead of fail with wrong type_driver

Some of us are using custom type_drivers. Puppet code should allow
unexpected values for type_drivers.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

commit_message:
Catch exception.OverQuota when create image for volume backed instance

When create image for a volume backed instance, nova will
create snapshots for all volumes attached to the instance
in Cinder, and if quota exceed in Cinder, HTTP 500 will
raise, we should capture this error and raise 403.

Change-Id: Ic62478e22a7477cfaefac3e63c383082d66bd635
Closes-Bug: #1689284
(cherry picked from commit 29c8ae3cd9653b310c3fac803e6295e5fa885d15)

commit_message:
Use novajoin-specific user and directory

This uses novajoin's user and directory for the novajoin service instead
of relying on the nova service user and /etc/nova. It also removes some
nova-specific parameters related to auth, to replace them with more
generic names.

Change-Id: I5e02164854542ad08b1b517f52334187913ee4e8

subject: Handle special characters in database connection URL netloc
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-22 15:34:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1673613-7357d40ba9ab1fa6.yaml', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': 'Handle special characters in database connection URL netloc

When calling "nova-manage cell_v2 simple_cell_setup" or
"nova-manage cell_v2 map_cell0" without passing in the
--database_connection option, we read the [database]/connection
URL from nova.conf, try to split the URL and then create a
default connection based on the name of the original connection,
so if you're cell database's name is 'nova' you'd end up with
'nova_cell0' for the cell0 database name in the URL.

The problem is the database connection URL has credentials in the
netloc and if the password has special characters in it, those can
mess up the URL split, like splitting on ? which is normally denoting
the beginning of the path in a URL.

This change handles special characters in the password by using
a nice DB connection URL parsing utility method available in
sqlalchemy to get the database name out of the connection URL string
so we can replace it properly with the _cell0 suffix.

Adds a release note as this bug causes issues when upgrading.

Change-Id: I7a7678e4af8160e6f48b96095154fca6ca48ff09
Closes-Bug: #1673613
(cherry picked from commit 9a9a620ea2d06e51c01b0864d7275b57d7203e5a)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle special characters in database connection URL netloc

When calling "nova-manage cell_v2 simple_cell_setup" or
"nova-manage cell_v2 map_cell0" without passing in the
--database_connection option, we read the [database]/connection
URL from nova.conf, try to split the URL and then create a
default connection based on the name of the original connection,
so if you're cell database's name is 'nova' you'd end up with
'nova_cell0' for the cell0 database name in the URL.

The problem is the database connection URL has credentials in the
netloc and if the password has special characters in it, those can
mess up the URL split, like splitting on ? which is normally denoting
the beginning of the path in a URL.

This change handles special characters in the password by using
a nice DB connection URL parsing utility method available in
sqlalchemy to get the database name out of the connection URL string
so we can replace it properly with the _cell0 suffix.

Adds a release note as this bug causes issues when upgrading.

Change-Id: I7a7678e4af8160e6f48b96095154fca6ca48ff09
Closes-Bug: #1673613
(cherry picked from commit 9a9a620ea2d06e51c01b0864d7275b57d7203e5a)

The method used to decode the encryption key has been updated to use

commit_message:
Fix decoding of encryption key passed to dmcrypt

This patch fixes the decoding of the encryption key passed to dmcrypt.
During the key management move from Nova to Castellan, in the Newton
release, conversion of the encryption key (from a string to list of
unsigned ints) was removed from the key retrieval method. This patch
updates dmcrypt to decode an encryption key string, rather than a list
of unsigned ints. See the linked bug for more information.

The method used to decode the encryption key has been updated to use
binascii, as done in os-brick [1], to maintain consistency. The key
generation and decoding portions of test_dmcrypt have been updated to
reflect this change and ensure compatibility with both, Python 2 and
Python 3.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/6cf9b1cd689f70a2c50c0fa83a9a9f7c502712a1/os_brick/encryptors/cryptsetup.py#L100-L102

Closes-Bug: #1688342
Change-Id: I050585ecb55742a972038cf72b0650321ded2856
(cherry picked from commit 53a71c1241aac70018c16d174032427a172378ed)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23186, 'name': 'Felipe Monteiro', 'email': 'felipe.carneiro.monteiro@gmail.com', 'username': 'felipe.monteiro'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-22 15:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_list.py', 'tempest/api/compute/base.py', 'tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_get.py', 'tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volume_snapshots.py', 'tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_negative.py'], 'message': 'Add max_microversion for compute volumes_extensions_client tests

The ``volumes_extensions_client`` [0] uses a deprecated nova
API, which starts throwing a 404 from microversion 2.36+ [1].

This patch adds max_microversion = '2.35' to compute tests that use the
``volumes_extensions_client`` and the ``snapshots_extensions_client``.

This can be tested by running:

curl -g -i -X GET http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2.1/os-volumes \
-H "OpenStack-API-Version: compute 2.35" \
-H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version: 2.35" \
-H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN"

which passes -- whereas replacing "2.35" with "2.36" above throws
a 404, in accordance with the documentation [1].

This patch also replaces ``volumes_extensions_client`` from
the base compute delete_volume classmethod with the ``volumes_client``.
This is because the functionality is identical: the former client
simply does a proxy call to Cinder, so we should use the non-deprecated
``volumes_client`` instead.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/clients.py#L174
[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#volume-extension-os-volumes-os-snapshots-deprecated

Change-Id: I4a1737aa4456580d8c8cb2df8d1c28792f774104
'}]
commit_message:
Add max_microversion for compute volumes_extensions_client tests

The ``volumes_extensions_client`` [0] uses a deprecated nova
API, which starts throwing a 404 from microversion 2.36+ [1].

This patch adds max_microversion = '2.35' to compute tests that use the
``volumes_extensions_client`` and the ``snapshots_extensions_client``.

This can be tested by running:

curl -g -i -X GET http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2.1/os-volumes \
-H "OpenStack-API-Version: compute 2.35" \
-H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version: 2.35" \
-H "X-Auth-Token: $TOKEN"

which passes -- whereas replacing "2.35" with "2.36" above throws
a 404, in accordance with the documentation [1].

This patch also replaces ``volumes_extensions_client`` from
the base compute delete_volume classmethod with the ``volumes_client``.
This is because the functionality is identical: the former client
simply does a proxy call to Cinder, so we should use the non-deprecated
``volumes_client`` instead.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/clients.py#L174
[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#volume-extension-os-volumes-os-snapshots-deprecated

Change-Id: I4a1737aa4456580d8c8cb2df8d1c28792f774104

commit_message:
Ensure that policy file has correct group/mode

When the policy file is copied from the templated
file to the active file, it loses its group/mode
settings. This patch ensures that they are properly
replicated during the copy.

Change-Id: I7a6c07cce405c8e7f3dca13cc24dc413895e6bfb

commit_message:
Add service dynamic log change/query

This patch adds 2 new APIs for microversion 3.32, one to dynamically
change the log level of cinder services, and the other that allows
querying their current log levels.

DocImpact
APIImpact
Implements: blueprint dynamic-log-levels
Change-Id: Ia5ef81135044733f1dd3970a116f97457b0371de

commit_message:
Test migration from pycrypto to cryptography

Add a test that ensures that the way we used to encrypt data with
pycrypto and the way we now encrypt data with cryptography produce
identical results.

subject: Update docker-cmd test for paunch idempotency
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-23 04:19:32.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tests/test_hook_docker_cmd.py'], 'message': 'Update docker-cmd test for paunch idempotency

The 1.1.0 release of paunch will add idempotency behaviour which
changes what docker calls are made.

This change updates the tests to match the changed docker calls, and
it will need to be merged to fix heat-agents CI after the release of
paunch-1.1.0.

Change-Id: I08e5060c3be232e7365af99e116e75fa85f5b39c
'}]
commit_message:
Update docker-cmd test for paunch idempotency

The 1.1.0 release of paunch will add idempotency behaviour which
changes what docker calls are made.

This change updates the tests to match the changed docker calls, and
it will need to be merged to fix heat-agents CI after the release of
paunch-1.1.0.

Change-Id: I08e5060c3be232e7365af99e116e75fa85f5b39c

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-04 18:56:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/pike/approved/use-service-catalog-for-endpoints.rst'], 'message': 'Updates for [glance]api_servers and ksa

The design for this blueprint has been fleshed out and discussed via IRC
and ML.  This change fleshes out some details with respect to specific
conf options and the source of those conf options (keystoneauth); and
also calls out that, unlike the other existing endpoint discovery conf
options, [glance]api_servers will continue to be supported.

Change-Id: I69909359b399283666e49ff2fe2d8622397648d5
Implements: bp use-service-catalog-for-endpoints
'}]
commit_message:
Updates for [glance]api_servers and ksa

The design for this blueprint has been fleshed out and discussed via IRC
and ML.  This change fleshes out some details with respect to specific
conf options and the source of those conf options (keystoneauth); and
also calls out that, unlike the other existing endpoint discovery conf
options, [glance]api_servers will continue to be supported.

Change-Id: I69909359b399283666e49ff2fe2d8622397648d5
Implements: bp use-service-catalog-for-endpoints

subject: Stop/disable/mask rpcbind on undercloud vm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-27 15:43:37.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test-oooq.sh', 'toci_gate_test-orig.sh'], 'message': 'Stop/disable/mask rpcbind on undercloud vm

This appears to be enabled on our underclouds for some reason, and
it makes our security overlords unhappy.

Ideally we would instead block this in the security group for the
undercloud vms, but due to the need for OVB compatibility we have
security groups disabled in rh1.  Once we move to using the neutron
port-security method for OVB we will be able to manage this via
security groups.

Change-Id: I2f7c1233a431b3f5efd5a189b9b8ecfcd790fc14
'}]
commit_message:
Stop/disable/mask rpcbind on undercloud vm

This appears to be enabled on our underclouds for some reason, and
it makes our security overlords unhappy.

Ideally we would instead block this in the security group for the
undercloud vms, but due to the need for OVB compatibility we have
security groups disabled in rh1.  Once we move to using the neutron
port-security method for OVB we will be able to manage this via
security groups.

Change-Id: I2f7c1233a431b3f5efd5a189b9b8ecfcd790fc14

commit_message:
Fixing some issues with v4 gates

1. kolla_install_type must be changed if gate job type is source
2. if Branch is v4, change image tags to 4.0.0
3. Adding cell related activities to nova service charts

Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-continuous-improvement

Change-Id: Ib99a7a71cd511854084514db4eba1db6d3a10a36

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-23 13:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/python-openstackclient/0002-Fix-creating-private-flavor-with-ID-auto.patch', 'openstack/python-openstackclient/python-openstackclient.spec.j2'], 'message': 'backport openstackclient: Fix creating a private flavor with ID auto

When a private flavor is created with ID auto (=default) and a project
is specified for it, instead of trying to add the project to the flavor
called "auto" the ID of the newly created project should be used.

Change-Id: Id0043d6c1d02f32a893eedde490705922f1292ed
'}]
commit_message:
backport openstackclient: Fix creating a private flavor with ID auto

When a private flavor is created with ID auto (=default) and a project
is specified for it, instead of trying to add the project to the flavor
called "auto" the ID of the newly created project should be used.

Change-Id: Id0043d6c1d02f32a893eedde490705922f1292ed

commit_message:
Fix attach issue for failed-over volume

VNX driver currently doesn't support attaching of failed-over volume,
if user try to do this, a error will pop up like:
    VNXAluNotFoundError: Error: storagegroup command failed

This fix address above issue, user can attach/detach any failed-over
volume.

Closes-bug: 1677956
Change-Id: I7802b7c57e438c27e4df225fb03ca4cda84e2620
(cherry picked from commit ff30688ee5e9e8bc5bc7c1c367bfd0482825586f)

commit_message:
rbd: resize volume not cloned but full copy

In case cloning was disabled by rbd_max_clone_depth=0 and only
a full copy will be created make sure the volume is resized in
case the destination volume is requested to be larger than the
source vol. Added new testcase to cover the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1559913

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I4b2af6c28c04335be1bc7ec53055c43485c8cde3
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

commit_message:
Blacklist sphinx 1.6.1

For some reason this release makes docs builds fail because it
can't resolve citations. The version in upper-constraints, which
we don't use in this repo, is 1.5.6, so blacklisting 1.6.1 seems
fine.

Change-Id: I2b73370876c80a88bd4a48db7fdd6ac23ace4503
Closes-Bug: #1693010

commit_message:
Add security-groups to container

This patch adds security groups to container, so that
user can access specific ports from outside. This patch
currently provide support only for DockerDriver.

Implements: Blueprint support-security-groups
Change-Id: I649fa55357ee6a8ec8221818a2de5466578491e7

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-05-19 22:53:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v3/shell.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-generic-reset-state-command-d83v1f3accbf5807.yaml', 'cinderclient/v3/groups.py', 'cinderclient/v2/volume_backups.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/test_shell.py', 'cinderclient/v3/group_snapshots.py', 'cinderclient/v3/volume_snapshots.py', 'cinderclient/tests/unit/v3/fakes.py'], 'message': "Cinder client reset-state improvements

Now we can use 'cinder reset-state' command for 'volume',
'snapshot', 'backup', 'group' and 'group-snapshot'.
Also change volume's default status from 'available' to
'None' when not any status is specified.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I0aefeaf5ece74f1f2bc4b72d5705c8c088921e20
Partial-implements: blueprint client-reset-state-improvements

commit_message:
Cinder client reset-state improvements

Now we can use 'cinder reset-state' command for 'volume',
'snapshot', 'backup', 'group' and 'group-snapshot'.
Also change volume's default status from 'available' to
'None' when not any status is specified.

Co-Authored-By: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I0aefeaf5ece74f1f2bc4b72d5705c8c088921e20
Partial-implements: blueprint client-reset-state-improvements

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-04 16:30:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/test_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/utils.py'], 'message': 'VMAX driver - Manage/Unmanage performance fix

Previously managing an existing volume made a call to the ECOM
server which retrieved every volume across all connected arrays.
When this call was made if there were heavily populated arrays
the call would hang and eventually crash. To get around this,
instead of seeking the volume at the start of the manage operation,
the relevant details are filled in to a CIMInstanceName object and
this object is used for a more directed search to the ECOM server,
returning the volume successfully if it exists.

Change-Id: Ib8a628016caf88f67ec54ce10bc735053b70c8c2
Closes-Bug: #1681888
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Manage/Unmanage performance fix

Previously managing an existing volume made a call to the ECOM
server which retrieved every volume across all connected arrays.
When this call was made if there were heavily populated arrays
the call would hang and eventually crash. To get around this,
instead of seeking the volume at the start of the manage operation,
the relevant details are filled in to a CIMInstanceName object and
this object is used for a more directed search to the ECOM server,
returning the volume successfully if it exists.

Change-Id: Ib8a628016caf88f67ec54ce10bc735053b70c8c2
Closes-Bug: #1681888

subject: [Trivial] SMBFS: fix passing image format using volume types
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-15 10:14:59.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/windows/smbfs.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/windows/test_smbfs.py'], 'message': "[Trivial] SMBFS: fix passing image format using volume types

The SMBFS driver accepted specifying the image format via volume
type extra specs. The main reason was that those images were supposed
to work with Hyper-V as well as KVM (which does not apply anymore).

A previous change broke this feature, always expecting the volume
extra specs key to be 'volume_format', without considering scopes
(which are required in this case).

At the moment, this feature may still be useful, for example opting
for vhd images for compatibility reasons. Also, we're considering
adding VHDSet format support, which may be requested through volume
type extra specs.

This change fixes this issue by checking the extra specs using the
'smbfs' scope.

Closes-Bug: #1690779

Change-Id: Iab6c7792a7611aea9db4b412c676e32d3370b13e
"}]
commit_message:
[Trivial] SMBFS: fix passing image format using volume types

The SMBFS driver accepted specifying the image format via volume
type extra specs. The main reason was that those images were supposed
to work with Hyper-V as well as KVM (which does not apply anymore).

A previous change broke this feature, always expecting the volume
extra specs key to be 'volume_format', without considering scopes
(which are required in this case).

At the moment, this feature may still be useful, for example opting
for vhd images for compatibility reasons. Also, we're considering
adding VHDSet format support, which may be requested through volume
type extra specs.

This change fixes this issue by checking the extra specs using the
'smbfs' scope.

Closes-Bug: #1690779

Change-Id: Iab6c7792a7611aea9db4b412c676e32d3370b13e

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I0dcc1b8e9f0dd51b6892126a2ef010e6f3a2d940

commit_message:
Make quota-class working better

Add three new quota API for admin to handle the quotas for projects,
new API allows the admin to create a typecal quota class, and use
this quota class to create or update an tenant's quotas quickly.

Change-Id: I936e33cc4eac301d22c0fdbb09c87da0042f9882
Implements: blueprint quota-class

commit_message:
Support multiple nova consuming one cinder

Sometimes it is desirable to have more than one consumer (e.g.
a nova instance) talking to a single cinder instance. This
currently only mostly works, since there are some cinder APIs
that call back to the nova API (assisted snapshots, locality
filter, retype/migrate of attached volumes).

This spec describes a potential fix.

API-Impact
Change-Id: I0220b6c6381a9519eae46d2f8b08c009bf2e1bf7
Depends-On: Ibddabbc9b2e61b2c1cab878881c4d37e3a13a6e7

commit_message:
GPFS Path: Fix bugs related to initialization of GPFS Driver

Due to lack of GPFS path ('/usr/lpp/mmfs/bin/') export, driver
is not able to find the GPFS commands causing the initialization
failure.
With this patch, GPFS will be able to run all GPFS commands
irrespective of GPFS path export.

Change-Id: I1aa8baf884dfaa42c37e575f0b6e1317f18543a1
Closes-bug: #1690785

Remove tests/charmhelpers from the repo and add charm-helpers to
test-requirements.txt.  Expect tests to succeed with the tip of
charmhelpers.  This has no effect on charmhelpers for hooks or
actions.

Add bindeps.txt to specify the bzr package requirement on test
runners, to support the bzr+lp: egg declaration format.

Move requirements.txt contents to test-requirements.txt and update
tox.ini to only use test-requirements.txt.

Many os-charm repos utilize both a requirements.txt file and a
test-requirements.txt file, while referencing both serially in all
tox test environments.  A single test-requirements.txt file should
be used instead.

Update requirements.txt with empty list and a comment for future
guidance to developers.

Update .gitignore for test result artifacts that may be created
in the checkout path.

Change-Id: I785c0aab0b5257fbb0645dc037257be88c41d244

commit_message:
Use virtualenv for tests/charmhelpers

Remove tests/charmhelpers from the repo and add charm-helpers to
test-requirements.txt.  Expect tests to succeed with the tip of
charmhelpers.  This has no effect on charmhelpers for hooks or
actions.

Add bindeps.txt to specify the bzr package requirement on test
runners, to support the bzr+lp: egg declaration format.

Move requirements.txt contents to test-requirements.txt and update
tox.ini to only use test-requirements.txt.

Many os-charm repos utilize both a requirements.txt file and a
test-requirements.txt file, while referencing both serially in all
tox test environments.  A single test-requirements.txt file should
be used instead.

Update requirements.txt with empty list and a comment for future
guidance to developers.

Update .gitignore for test result artifacts that may be created
in the checkout path.

Change-Id: I785c0aab0b5257fbb0645dc037257be88c41d244

commit_message:
Deprecate memcached_servers parameter

It is 'memcache_servers' in group [cache], not 'memcached_servers'.
For better understanding, deprecate memcached_servers option and
use memcahce_servers instead.

Change-Id: I57d7b45438904387176200c0062b7f33f4268006
Closes-Bug: #1690981

commit_message:
Correct hugepage percentage memory calculation

psutil.virtual_memory() returns values in bytes, not kilobytes.

Ensure 2MB hugepage size is calculated in the same units, ensuring
that % calculations are correct.

Resync of charmhelpers to fixup amulet test issues due to newer
client versions.

Change-Id: I95c431edcf316d194de752048ec1503d8fe996f1
Closes-Bug: 1678185

subject: Add retries for pcs cluster setup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 15:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/corosync.pp'], 'message': "Add retries for pcs cluster setup

In bug #1677312 we encountered an error where pcs cluster start --all
would return 1, due to pcsd on one node being in the middle of a restart
(due to ssl keys exchange).

It turns out this can also happen during the pcs cluster setup call, so
let's add the proper retries there as well. This has
been spotted a couple of time in largish clusters.

Closes-Bug: #1692923

Change-Id: Ia5d820c97d5dfdaaa03aff2721612937e0efa2e6
"}]
commit_message:
Add retries for pcs cluster setup

In bug #1677312 we encountered an error where pcs cluster start --all
would return 1, due to pcsd on one node being in the middle of a restart
(due to ssl keys exchange).

It turns out this can also happen during the pcs cluster setup call, so
let's add the proper retries there as well. This has
been spotted a couple of time in largish clusters.

Closes-Bug: #1692923

Change-Id: Ia5d820c97d5dfdaaa03aff2721612937e0efa2e6

subject: Correct the filter name for changes-since spec
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-03 07:33:43.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/query-cinder-resources-filter-by-change-since.rst'], 'message': "Correct the filter name for changes-since spec

There are some projects that support this filter:

changes-since: nova, glance(for api v2, it's only mentioned in spec)
changed-since: neutron

So for keeping consistent with most of projects, Cinder considers to
use changes-since and changes-before too.

Change-Id: Ie226e450ab6f2e246547a7ee7a179cad94d0018e
"}]
commit_message:
Correct the filter name for changes-since spec

There are some projects that support this filter:

changes-since: nova, glance(for api v2, it's only mentioned in spec)
changed-since: neutron

So for keeping consistent with most of projects, Cinder considers to
use changes-since and changes-before too.

Change-Id: Ie226e450ab6f2e246547a7ee7a179cad94d0018e

commit_message:
Use the list iterator instead of six iterator

We should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will be more readable.
In py2, the performance about list should be negligible

Change-Id: I111faa266a0fa98819d77a5dcdc9bb8c2def391a

commit_message:
Warn instead of fail with wrong type_driver

Some of us are using custom type_drivers. Puppet code should allow
unexpected values for type_drivers.

commit_message:
Change CLI default API version

This adds a specification proposing bumping the default API version used
by ironic CLI and the baremetal OpenStack CLI plugin to the latest
available version. The client library is outside of the scope of this
spec.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <divius.inside@gmail.com>

Related-Bug: #1671145

commit_message:
VNX: allow specify pool name for replication

Currently, VNX driver will select a pool of same name as the
source volume when creating LUN replication. An error will occur if not
satisfied.
This patch will allow setting a different pool name for replication
target instead of using the pool of same name on the remote system.

DocImpact

Closes-bug: 1677561
Change-Id: Ia86c9a5c815c19d0096524b88d992d84266688f9
(cherry picked from commit 00b8a6ad2cc221869534116ded78c57e28b6c4d8)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-11 06:43:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_image_utils.py'], 'message': "Separate out routine for getting qemu_img_info

Without try...catch like fetch_to_volume_format,
fetch_verify_image will prevent a raw image from being used when qemu-img
is not installed.

So we add a try...catch for qemu_img_info for fetch_verify_image and
separate this into its own routine.

This fixes the failure if you create a volume with a raw, nonqemu image
and don't have the qemu packages on your system.

Change-Id: I3aaf43a453e7096161780d9bfc2515c66a3a9f2c
Closes-Bug: #1674771
(cherry picked from commit 70a0cc921f5fbbc7a6b59b4e3c87d3f24eb15c63)
"}]
commit_message:
Separate out routine for getting qemu_img_info

Without try...catch like fetch_to_volume_format,
fetch_verify_image will prevent a raw image from being used when qemu-img
is not installed.

So we add a try...catch for qemu_img_info for fetch_verify_image and
separate this into its own routine.

This fixes the failure if you create a volume with a raw, nonqemu image
and don't have the qemu packages on your system.

Change-Id: I3aaf43a453e7096161780d9bfc2515c66a3a9f2c
Closes-Bug: #1674771
(cherry picked from commit 70a0cc921f5fbbc7a6b59b4e3c87d3f24eb15c63)

commit_message:
Ensure tasks are not skipped

- The lookup of the first file should only be skipped
  when necessary (the apt bits).

- On the block/rescue: The rescue task didn't run, so if the when
  didn't trigger, no virt will be set, unless the
  ``cat /proc/cpuinfo`` failed.

Change-Id: I6e89de1c9d1828003a83c5ca2b5b56d64c12f30c

subject: Source template files from git or deploy host
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-23 10:32:38.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/deploy-node-config-files-1b272a3ec7ed71b8.yaml', 'tasks/ceilometer_post_install.yml', 'templates/rootwrap.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Source template files from git or deploy host

Instead of sourcing the paste/policy files from the role,
the deploy host will first be checked, then the git source.

The current mechanism uses a lookup, causing the fetch of
the default templates to happen via curl from the deployment
node. This causes problems if the deployment node does not
have access to the repo server web service, which may be the
case in high security environments.

This patch changes the mechanism to only use the lookup
module for the file content that is on the deployment node,
then falls back to using the uri module to fetch the default
content. This ensures that the deployment node does not have
to reach into the environment for the content.

The pattern applied is the same as that used in the
combination of the following two reference patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/446235
- https://review.openstack.org/463390

The rootwrap.conf template is re-added because it cannot be
used verbatim from the upstream repository. It requires the
addition of the service venv bin in the exec_dirs. A mechanism
to implement this dynamically will be figured out in a later
review along with an implementation which will fetch the
rootwrap files directly from the git source too.

Conflicts:
       defaults/main.yml
       tasks/ceilometer_post_install.yml

Change-Id: I248910a544f611b590bc93449aea98434802cae3
(cherry picked from commit 9e96b651260cd0d63babab9bbc685b3c329c7060)
'}]
commit_message:
Source template files from git or deploy host

Instead of sourcing the paste/policy files from the role,
the deploy host will first be checked, then the git source.

The current mechanism uses a lookup, causing the fetch of
the default templates to happen via curl from the deployment
node. This causes problems if the deployment node does not
have access to the repo server web service, which may be the
case in high security environments.

This patch changes the mechanism to only use the lookup
module for the file content that is on the deployment node,
then falls back to using the uri module to fetch the default
content. This ensures that the deployment node does not have
to reach into the environment for the content.

The pattern applied is the same as that used in the
combination of the following two reference patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/446235
- https://review.openstack.org/463390

The rootwrap.conf template is re-added because it cannot be
used verbatim from the upstream repository. It requires the
addition of the service venv bin in the exec_dirs. A mechanism
to implement this dynamically will be figured out in a later
review along with an implementation which will fetch the
rootwrap files directly from the git source too.

Conflicts:
       defaults/main.yml
       tasks/ceilometer_post_install.yml

Change-Id: I248910a544f611b590bc93449aea98434802cae3
(cherry picked from commit 9e96b651260cd0d63babab9bbc685b3c329c7060)

commit_message:
Added option to enable_vpn

due to the fact that Neutron kicked out VPNaaS from governance.
We should disable vpn out of the box but give the option to deploy it.

REL.:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107384.html

Change-Id: Ieff504cdcd86bc31e8c3553b428968665259255f
