fix stable branch membership detection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-22 17:36:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/tests/test_validate.py', 'openstack_releases/gitutils.py'], 'message': 'fix stable branch membership detection

The rules for stable branch releases need to be relaxed a bit to account
for projects that are late to create their branches and only do so after
the default branch has been updated. This change makes the rules more
flexible so that it is possible to release for a stable branch on master
as long as that stable branch does not exist. The primary use for this
is to release and then create the stable branch in the same patch.

Change-Id: I2d8f9abcf8ffa34e29eb7021830fd635e6e0f85f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix stable branch membership detection

The rules for stable branch releases need to be relaxed a bit to account
for projects that are late to create their branches and only do so after
the default branch has been updated. This change makes the rules more
flexible so that it is possible to release for a stable branch on master
as long as that stable branch does not exist. The primary use for this
is to release and then create the stable branch in the same patch.

Change-Id: I2d8f9abcf8ffa34e29eb7021830fd635e6e0f85f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: NFS Backup: Fix overwritting backups
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-18 08:39:15.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_posix.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/posix.py', 'releasenotes/notes/nfs_backup_no_overwrite-be7b545453baf7a3.yaml'], 'message': 'NFS Backup: Fix overwritting backups

When using the NFS backup driver if we do multiple backups using the
same container we end up overwriting older backups.

The issue comes from a misunderstanding in the Posix backup driver of
the purpose of the "prefix" metadata used in the ChunkedBackupDriver
base class.

This prefix is for the name of the backup objects to store, but unlike
the prefix for the volumes, here it must be unique as the base driver
will only add numbers to identify the chunk (for the volume we add the
volume id).  Unfortunately the Posix driver just assumed that the prefix
had the same meaning as the prefix for volumes thus making one backups
override one another.

This patch changes the prefix generated by the Posix driver so we have
the following format: "volume_$VOL_ID_$TIMESTAMP_backup_$BACK_ID", thus
allowing multiple backups in the same container.

The new name is backward compatible with existing backups because the
new prefix will only be used on new backups as the prefix for already
existing backups is stored in the DB.

Change-Id: I2903c27633facde6370d95ba0b9e06025ccaef26
Closes-Bug: #1628768
'}]
commit_message:
NFS Backup: Fix overwritting backups

When using the NFS backup driver if we do multiple backups using the
same container we end up overwriting older backups.

The issue comes from a misunderstanding in the Posix backup driver of
the purpose of the "prefix" metadata used in the ChunkedBackupDriver
base class.

This prefix is for the name of the backup objects to store, but unlike
the prefix for the volumes, here it must be unique as the base driver
will only add numbers to identify the chunk (for the volume we add the
volume id).  Unfortunately the Posix driver just assumed that the prefix
had the same meaning as the prefix for volumes thus making one backups
override one another.

This patch changes the prefix generated by the Posix driver so we have
the following format: "volume_$VOL_ID_$TIMESTAMP_backup_$BACK_ID", thus
allowing multiple backups in the same container.

The new name is backward compatible with existing backups because the
new prefix will only be used on new backups as the prefix for already
existing backups is stored in the DB.

Change-Id: I2903c27633facde6370d95ba0b9e06025ccaef26
Closes-Bug: #1628768

subject: Increase swap size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 11:22:35.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': "Increase swap size

While testing incoming release of eventlet 0.20.1 we've
discovered that it's increasing memory usage for processes
using eventlet. It has been reported upstream [1] but
aparently this is expected.

p-o-i scenario003 is pretty heavy in terms of memory. Before new
eventlet version it's already using ~700-800MB swap in my tests and
with new eventlet (not pushed to RDO Testing repo yet) it has failed
with out-of-memory problems from time to time.

With this patch, i'm increasing swap size from 2GB to 4GB to avoid
oom problems. Note that this may derive in performance issues if
we start having too much swap usage, but i haven't hit it in my
local tests.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/412

Change-Id: If333ae62dbae3f597d2b14ae1dd4c174ecdf51fc
"}]
commit_message:
Increase swap size

While testing incoming release of eventlet 0.20.1 we've
discovered that it's increasing memory usage for processes
using eventlet. It has been reported upstream [1] but
aparently this is expected.

p-o-i scenario003 is pretty heavy in terms of memory. Before new
eventlet version it's already using ~700-800MB swap in my tests and
with new eventlet (not pushed to RDO Testing repo yet) it has failed
with out-of-memory problems from time to time.

With this patch, i'm increasing swap size from 2GB to 4GB to avoid
oom problems. Note that this may derive in performance issues if
we start having too much swap usage, but i haven't hit it in my
local tests.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/412

Change-Id: If333ae62dbae3f597d2b14ae1dd4c174ecdf51fc

subject: nova: use default value for $vncserver_listen
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-12 12:50:00.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/nova.pp'], 'message': "nova: use default value for $vncserver_listen

Instead of overriding nova::compute::libvirt::vncserver_listen, just use
the default value, so we can check that nova-compute will bind the
process on 127.0.0.1 and not 0.0.0.0.

It's recommanded for security to use an host IP address, instead of
0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I724e8485d9fa58c213606ef0b30e2483d8a04802
"}]
commit_message:
nova: use default value for $vncserver_listen

Instead of overriding nova::compute::libvirt::vncserver_listen, just use
the default value, so we can check that nova-compute will bind the
process on 127.0.0.1 and not 0.0.0.0.

It's recommanded for security to use an host IP address, instead of
0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I724e8485d9fa58c213606ef0b30e2483d8a04802

commit_message:
rehome utils: synchronized decorator and load_class_by_alias_or_classname

This patch rehomes the neutron common utils:
- load_class_by_alias_or_classname() function.
- synchronized decorator.

also be used as part of rehoming the logic in neutron's
manager module.

commit_message:
Support os_version, os_type, and os_distro image properties

Modified default images to use os_type, os_version and os_distro
properties.  Added logic to look for distribution/os_distro,
type/os_type and version/os_version image properties when
matching image properties.

Cleaned up minor python warnings in tosca_compute.py

Removed DOS-style newline characters from
tosca_cluster_policies_scaling.py

Change-Id: I72043cf4a4358cfdbc8f98238276d85dc2f5bcc0
Closes-Bug: 1689673

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-quota-sets endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds os-quota-sets related routes by a plain list, instead
of using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves to the
plain routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading will be
removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I2b9b3f2acef09e553245ce6ebac18f26269d81d0

subject: Replace pycrypto with cryptography
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 17645, 'name': 'Shan Guo', 'email': 'guoshan.jolie@gmail.com', 'username': 'guoshan'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 20466, 'name': 'Tin Lam', 'email': 'tin@lam.wtf', 'username': 'tinlam'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2017-05-22 22:25:26.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_memcache_crypt.py', 'keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_memcache_crypt.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1677308-a2fa7de67f21cd84.yaml'], 'message': 'Replace pycrypto with cryptography

The pycrypto library is unmaintained, and keystonemiddleware currently
uses pycrypto to encrypt and decrpyt things before caching them.
This patch set removes the pycrypto dependency and updates the code
to use the cryptography library.  See [1].  Replacing the cryptographic
library is backward compatible.  See [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568.html
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/610186/

Change-Id: Iced7f5115e49ccf4f7f5bf6813cb5988b95c248b
Closes-Bug: #1677308
'}]
commit_message:
Replace pycrypto with cryptography

The pycrypto library is unmaintained, and keystonemiddleware currently
uses pycrypto to encrypt and decrpyt things before caching them.
This patch set removes the pycrypto dependency and updates the code
to use the cryptography library.  See [1].  Replacing the cryptographic
library is backward compatible.  See [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113568.html
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/610186/

Change-Id: Iced7f5115e49ccf4f7f5bf6813cb5988b95c248b
Closes-Bug: #1677308

commit_message:
Fixes Windows Server 2016 Network Controller constants

In order to properly use the Windows Server 2016 Network Controller,
a switch port must have set a port profile with some very specific
constants, otherwise it won't work. [1]

[1] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/networking/sdn/manage/create-a-tenant-vm

Change-Id: Ic3788ed8945e337ab9bd345731be8792c0d346b7
Partially-Implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support

This is needed since it's what writes the service metadata to the nova

commit_message:
docker/TLS-everywhere: Add metadata_settings output to templates

This is needed since it's what writes the service metadata to the nova
server in order to create the kerberos principals. It worked in a base
controller since the keystone template does have this. But if we would
deploy these services on a separate role, it would break. So this output
is needed.

bp tls-via-certmonger-containers

Change-Id: I3ee8c65d356dcd092a3fbf79041e5c69ef23b721

subject: Improve leapfrog pluggability
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 10:23:28.000000000', 'files': ['leap-upgrades/re-deploy.sh', 'leap-upgrades/run-stages.sh'], 'message': 'Improve leapfrog pluggability

The leapfrog is quite static, and a deployer can only run
scripts before and after the process.

By adding this, a deployer can alter the re-deploy behavior.
It can now run playbooks or shell scripts after the migrations,
and modify the re-deploy behavior (by adding more playbooks for
example).

Change-Id: Idde1e94d014fe4ca527568641a04c847a710d801
'}]
commit_message:
Improve leapfrog pluggability

The leapfrog is quite static, and a deployer can only run
scripts before and after the process.

By adding this, a deployer can alter the re-deploy behavior.
It can now run playbooks or shell scripts after the migrations,
and modify the re-deploy behavior (by adding more playbooks for
example).

Change-Id: Idde1e94d014fe4ca527568641a04c847a710d801

subject: Fix get_compute_usage normalization problem
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 13:01:04.000000000', 'files': ['shade/__init__.py', 'shade/_normalize.py'], 'message': "Fix get_compute_usage normalization problem

When we normalize an empty usage report, start and end can be empty, so
the pop() call fails. Don't fail on that.

Also, stop forcing interface=admin in operator_cloud. We stopped adding
 this elsewhere already, because it turns out it's NOT actually a thing
 anyone should ever do by default. (It's an old keystone v2 thing -
jamielennox says it should be avoided like the plague) Make
operator_cloud consistent. (This will still honor interface=admin if
it's in the clouds.yaml file)

Change-Id: I432dc58d60fb56ce13332443435138354d66e9e1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get_compute_usage normalization problem

When we normalize an empty usage report, start and end can be empty, so
the pop() call fails. Don't fail on that.

Also, stop forcing interface=admin in operator_cloud. We stopped adding
 this elsewhere already, because it turns out it's NOT actually a thing
 anyone should ever do by default. (It's an old keystone v2 thing -
jamielennox says it should be avoided like the plague) Make
operator_cloud consistent. (This will still honor interface=admin if
it's in the clouds.yaml file)

Change-Id: I432dc58d60fb56ce13332443435138354d66e9e1

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: nova-install and nova-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Change-Id: I1f9b203dfe17d65b8b90eb6079bd07b7686c94ab

commit_message:
Add neutron-vpnaas in-tree documentation

One of the requirements[1] for Neutron stadium projects is to have
in-tree developer documentation.  This creates a stub for that.  We can
expand on it once the stub is in, but this will permit us to set up
publishing while we iterate on it.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/stadium/governance.html#checklist

subject: Validation before perform node deallocation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-24 14:18:47.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/oneview/deploy_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-oneview-deallocate-server-8256e279af837e5d.yaml', 'ironic/drivers/modules/oneview/power.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/oneview/test_power.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/oneview/test_deploy_utils.py'], 'message': 'Validation before perform node deallocation

Introduces a new validation to ensure the node deallocation
process will only be performed to nodes that have Server
Profile applied in OneView. When the allocation process
fails, the machine will have no Server Profile applied in
OneView and in ironic it will have no reference to any
Server Profile. Under these conditions if the deallocation
process be performed the driver will try to delete a
nonexistent Server Profile in OneView, leaving the node
in error state in ironic.

Change-Id: I83cef7fafac4e22ebf5eb4fe83f6da26ec132c99
Closes-Bug: #1657892
(cherry picked from commit 0b23a041f1111ad112d28619fa020173805edbbe)
'}]
commit_message:
Validation before perform node deallocation

Introduces a new validation to ensure the node deallocation
process will only be performed to nodes that have Server
Profile applied in OneView. When the allocation process
fails, the machine will have no Server Profile applied in
OneView and in ironic it will have no reference to any
Server Profile. Under these conditions if the deallocation
process be performed the driver will try to delete a
nonexistent Server Profile in OneView, leaving the node
in error state in ironic.

Change-Id: I83cef7fafac4e22ebf5eb4fe83f6da26ec132c99
Closes-Bug: #1657892
(cherry picked from commit 0b23a041f1111ad112d28619fa020173805edbbe)

subject: Dummy patch to build a new rpm in RDO
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-18 22:45:03.000000000', 'files': ['elements/delorean-repo/pre-install.d/01-delorean-repo', 'README.md'], 'message': "Dummy patch to build a new rpm in RDO

The version of openstack-tripleo-image-elements in RDO for stable
branches is too old and it might be one of the reasons why TripleO CI is
failing to deploy TripleO on Newton.

See: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690373

This patch is doing nothing important but by merging it, we'll build a
new package in RDO for master and all branches and hopefully get a new
build that will help us to resolve the issue.

Change-Id: Ie6c21aa8d071e791eb0df6db6d700074d3141cf0
Related-Bug: #1690373
(cherry picked from commit cc32f26871484a77b56582a546b3a84cfba586bd)
"}]
commit_message:
Dummy patch to build a new rpm in RDO

The version of openstack-tripleo-image-elements in RDO for stable
branches is too old and it might be one of the reasons why TripleO CI is
failing to deploy TripleO on Newton.

See: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690373

This patch is doing nothing important but by merging it, we'll build a
new package in RDO for master and all branches and hopefully get a new
build that will help us to resolve the issue.

Change-Id: Ie6c21aa8d071e791eb0df6db6d700074d3141cf0
Related-Bug: #1690373
(cherry picked from commit cc32f26871484a77b56582a546b3a84cfba586bd)

branches is too old and it might be one of the reasons why TripleO CI is

This patch is doing nothing important but by merging it, we'll build a

(cherry picked from commit cc32f26871484a77b56582a546b3a84cfba586bd)

commit_message:
Dummy patch to build a new rpm in RDO

The version of openstack-tripleo-image-elements in RDO for stable
branches is too old and it might be one of the reasons why TripleO CI is
failing to deploy TripleO on Newton.

See: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690373

This patch is doing nothing important but by merging it, we'll build a
new package in RDO for master and all branches and hopefully get a new
build that will help us to resolve the issue.

Change-Id: Ie6c21aa8d071e791eb0df6db6d700074d3141cf0
Related-Bug: #1690373
(cherry picked from commit cc32f26871484a77b56582a546b3a84cfba586bd)

commit_message:
Use provided unit scope in db_changed

If the unit parameter is passed to the db_changed function, ensure
that its used instead of the remote_unit function so that db_changed
can be called outside of the db-relation-changed hook context.

Change-Id: I30b42522ed982213176e485a1140ed872fc571df
Closes-Bug: 1688401
(cherry picked from commit 11bfc1e529d93cd06f15745413578a38c464f1a2)

commit_message:
Get Cell UUID based on Cell name variable

In I751ea370819379687b04f06e71afa68579bcbc69 we added steps to check for
cell1 UUID and then map instances accordingly. We should do this based
on the name variable and not a forced "cell1" value.

Change-Id: Iee6d6a80fa487ea00055edaef389047d80687c06

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-30 12:28:31.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_reset_environment.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_node_disks.py'], 'message': "Increase tests timeout during environment resets

It looks like computation power on upstream's py27
executors was decreased. As a result we got periodical
timeouts instead of successful test execution. This
patch proposes the simplest workaround: increase
timeout value.

Change-Id: I1acaf4aefe7e2c6ed6c0f5fcd14df0b52053b236
Closes-bug: #1677570
"}]
commit_message:
Increase tests timeout during environment resets

It looks like computation power on upstream's py27
executors was decreased. As a result we got periodical
timeouts instead of successful test execution. This
patch proposes the simplest workaround: increase
timeout value.

Change-Id: I1acaf4aefe7e2c6ed6c0f5fcd14df0b52053b236
Closes-bug: #1677570

subject: Catch all errors and provide failure summary
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-05-22 20:38:18.000000000', 'files': ['bowling_ball/rolling_tests.py'], 'message': "Catch all errors and provide failure summary

In order for the gates to get a meaningful metric to pass/fail against,
write out the percent of failed attempts (that is, attempts that caused
some exception) after receiving a termination/interrupt.

Along with this, change the except clause in the test loop to catch all
failures and log them, rather than aborting the program. This will allow
the program to keep running until explicitly stopped, providing more
accurate results.

Since the exceptions are being caught at the loop level, the tests
themselves can use a 'happy path,' without doing their own error
handling. This makes implementation of tests more straightforward.

Change-Id: I10436d1f3e99234aa167ab7a765e59d46d54eeb8
"}]
commit_message:
Catch all errors and provide failure summary

In order for the gates to get a meaningful metric to pass/fail against,
write out the percent of failed attempts (that is, attempts that caused
some exception) after receiving a termination/interrupt.

Along with this, change the except clause in the test loop to catch all
failures and log them, rather than aborting the program. This will allow
the program to keep running until explicitly stopped, providing more
accurate results.

Since the exceptions are being caught at the loop level, the tests
themselves can use a 'happy path,' without doing their own error
handling. This makes implementation of tests more straightforward.

Change-Id: I10436d1f3e99234aa167ab7a765e59d46d54eeb8

subject: [Regions] Fixing determining keystone for actions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-22 12:00:17.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/utils/openstack/keystone.py'], 'message': '[Regions] Fixing determining keystone for actions

 * With default region, it was not possible
 to correctly determine keystone endpoint
 for a set of actions: nova, mistral etc.
 because they use the same default region
 for keystone endpoint if none provided.
 Keystone endpoint should rather be gotten
 using keystone_authtoken.region_name config
 option.

 Note: fix does not affect keystone actions.
 Keystone actions use auth_uri from context as
 an endpoint.

Change-Id: I8abd59790d4bf60ed71ae3100492b782c35ad6ce
'}]
commit_message:
[Regions] Fixing determining keystone for actions

 * With default region, it was not possible
 to correctly determine keystone endpoint
 for a set of actions: nova, mistral etc.
 because they use the same default region
 for keystone endpoint if none provided.
 Keystone endpoint should rather be gotten
 using keystone_authtoken.region_name config
 option.

 Note: fix does not affect keystone actions.
 Keystone actions use auth_uri from context as
 an endpoint.

Change-Id: I8abd59790d4bf60ed71ae3100492b782c35ad6ce

commit_message:
Oslo i18n 3.15.2 has broken deps

Oslo i18n removed babel from requirements but it has a runtime
dependency on it, so it fails to install.

Related-Bug: #1692773

commit_message:
Fix broken database migration

Foreign key was created on provisioning_status for several tables in
9b5473976d6d_add_provisioning_status_to_objects.py.  Dropping the
constraint before table column is altered, and creating the constraint
again afterwards.

Change-Id: Ice5411ef9e9648d61d7136fcf531af9a15a83825

subject: Panko.conf cannot be copied in ceilometer role
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-23 12:28:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Panko.conf cannot be copied in ceilometer role

Deploying ceilometer fails if panko is enabled
while copying panko.conf.
The issue is that the task copy the file to /etc/kolla/panko
instead of /etc/kolla/<service-name>/

Change-Id: I4e0f39d32720fd84e6495d0be564747db181e3eb
Closes-Bug: #1684833
'}]
commit_message:
Panko.conf cannot be copied in ceilometer role

Deploying ceilometer fails if panko is enabled
while copying panko.conf.
The issue is that the task copy the file to /etc/kolla/panko
instead of /etc/kolla/<service-name>/

Change-Id: I4e0f39d32720fd84e6495d0be564747db181e3eb
Closes-Bug: #1684833

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-16 15:05:14.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "TripleO: container upgrade non-voting, not experimental

Promote container upgrade job from experimental to non-voting. The job
is now expected to be stable, and we'd like to prevent it from breaking
by running it on all tripleo-ci, t-h-t, tripleo-common and puppet-tripleo changes,
as non-voting currently.
Also do not run this job before Pike, since we don't support this
workflow.

Change-Id: Ia15827d0b68884261070603bfb2fd0226799b37e
"}]
commit_message:
TripleO: container upgrade non-voting, not experimental

Promote container upgrade job from experimental to non-voting. The job
is now expected to be stable, and we'd like to prevent it from breaking
by running it on all tripleo-ci, t-h-t, tripleo-common and puppet-tripleo changes,
as non-voting currently.
Also do not run this job before Pike, since we don't support this
workflow.

Change-Id: Ia15827d0b68884261070603bfb2fd0226799b37e

commit_message:
Fixes use of pre-existing workflows for OS::Mistral::Workflow

Previously the OS::Mistral::Workflow resource would mistakenly
raise an error if an error to a pre-existing workflow was used
as one of its tasks.

Change-Id: Ibc5707f9f06266fe84ad1dd91dcb984157871d30
Closes-Bug: #1689266

After introducing the change Iead5167210c4132badb866afc25d4ef14e27f6b2
swift isn't installed if ceph used as a backend for images
and not for object-storage service. In this sutiation we end up
with absence of object-storage at all which is wrong.

The commit introduces changes which makes possible
to swift been installed if ceph used only for image service.

Change-Id: If319845aa9f2d9b3ca07936350ef374f504679cb
Closes-Bug: #1604879
"}]
commit_message:
Correct logical expressions for storage backends

After introducing the change Iead5167210c4132badb866afc25d4ef14e27f6b2
swift isn't installed if ceph used as a backend for images
and not for object-storage service. In this sutiation we end up
with absence of object-storage at all which is wrong.

The commit introduces changes which makes possible
to swift been installed if ceph used only for image service.

Change-Id: If319845aa9f2d9b3ca07936350ef374f504679cb
Closes-Bug: #1604879

commit_message:
Remove nova cert from devstack examples

As a followup to I2c78a0c6599b92040146cf9f0042cff8fd2509c3, the nova

subject: tox_install: speed up neutron repo clone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-22 03:58:40.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh'], 'message': 'tox_install: speed up neutron repo clone

When installing neutron repo into tox venv, there is no need to
use full clone. Shallow clone like --depth 1 is sufficient.
It speeds up tox venv creation.

In my local env, the data volume transferred during neutron repo clone
was reduced from around 50MB to 3.6MB and the time take was reduced
from 60sec to 13sec. In slower network connection environments,
it would have an positive effect more.

Change-Id: Ib8964fc029a2eab839c8022ad48ef40541e83780
'}]
commit_message:
tox_install: speed up neutron repo clone

When installing neutron repo into tox venv, there is no need to
use full clone. Shallow clone like --depth 1 is sufficient.
It speeds up tox venv creation.

In my local env, the data volume transferred during neutron repo clone
was reduced from around 50MB to 3.6MB and the time take was reduced
from 60sec to 13sec. In slower network connection environments,
it would have an positive effect more.

Change-Id: Ib8964fc029a2eab839c8022ad48ef40541e83780

Add copy ceph keyring files conditions in cinder

If used external ceph for cinder,the ceph storage not enable cephx.
So ceph keyring file not does not exist.
Task throw warning of copy over ceph keyring files.

commit_message:
Fix secure_proxy_ssl_header option in nova

Option "secure_proxy_ssl_header" from group "DEFAULT"  has been
deprecated in the N release and has been removed in the O release.

Use wsgi.secure_proxy_ssl_header configuration instead.

see
https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/config-reference/compute/config-options.html
https://docs.openstack.org/newton/config-reference/tables/conf-changes/nova.html
https://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/compute/config-options.html

Change-Id: Icf3eea66f4ac281641ba22e8194aa113b57f6ce8

commit_message:
Declarative approach to parsing JSON fields

Replaces explicit fields parsing and validation with sqlalchemy-alike
class-level declarations. This allows uniform handling of fields in
different resources, especially wrt validation.

Change-Id: Ia1f2fbb6d2358831bafc7386e4a1cecd235de892

subject: Advertise public heat endpoint for wait conditions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-04 17:54:53.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/heat/templates/heat.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Advertise public heat endpoint for wait conditions

Wait conditions are commonly used by instances to signal various events
back to heat. These instances are unlikely to have access to the
internal API endpoints. OpenStack-Ansible had a similar issue[1] back in
juno and changed to use the public endpoint[2]. The code has now moved
but the default is still in place[3].

This change configures heat to advertise the public API as the endpoint
for wait conditions.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1459414
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186221/
[3] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_heat/blob/b1721a7460ba816afabd9bded6e5c79c635bca3a/defaults/main.yml#L48

Change-Id: Id1d66aaa298efa8407db579a899a5aacebe1e6c7
Closes-Bug: #1688331
'}]
commit_message:
Advertise public heat endpoint for wait conditions

Wait conditions are commonly used by instances to signal various events
back to heat. These instances are unlikely to have access to the
internal API endpoints. OpenStack-Ansible had a similar issue[1] back in
juno and changed to use the public endpoint[2]. The code has now moved
but the default is still in place[3].

This change configures heat to advertise the public API as the endpoint
for wait conditions.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1459414
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186221/
[3] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_heat/blob/b1721a7460ba816afabd9bded6e5c79c635bca3a/defaults/main.yml#L48

Change-Id: Id1d66aaa298efa8407db579a899a5aacebe1e6c7
Closes-Bug: #1688331

commit_message:
Fix allow_access bug when share instance status is error

Currently if share instance's 'access_rules_status' is
error we would have a InvalidShareInstance error when
calling allow_access api. However the access db record
is still added and this is confusing.

Change-Id: I6ecb90deabc503adf42c01077e31a57d428d8e0f
Related-bug: #1648377

commit_message:
Add VMware DataStore support to glance

Add configure the VMware Storage Backend in glance-api.
Because of the following document was not updated:
https://docs.openstack.org/developer/glance/configuring.html#configuring-the-vmware-storage-backend

So,see code:
https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/master/glance_store/_drivers/vmware_datastore.py
https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/master/glance_store/backend.py

Partially-implements: blueprint kolla-ansible-support-vsphere

Change-Id: Icb73ec501aabd938eb23257518ce0650a329bef3

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-18 18:01:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py'], 'message': "DVR: Do not check HA state on DVR-only routers

Trying to check HA state on a DVR-only compute node
can trigger:

AttributeError: 'DvrLocalRouter' object has no attribute 'ha_state'

Also moved the mode assignment outside of the loops
since it only needs to be done once.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Redmond <sean.redmond1@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: #1691427
Change-Id: I3e48e06e76325939fbc9533b0198924bc96d600e
"}]
commit_message:
DVR: Do not check HA state on DVR-only routers

Trying to check HA state on a DVR-only compute node
can trigger:

AttributeError: 'DvrLocalRouter' object has no attribute 'ha_state'

Also moved the mode assignment outside of the loops
since it only needs to be done once.

Co-Authored-By: Sean Redmond <sean.redmond1@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: #1691427
Change-Id: I3e48e06e76325939fbc9533b0198924bc96d600e

commit_message:
Displays error message for template validation

This fix helps to propagate the error message received from the http
client.  The error message was hidden by a generic message instead of
using the information provided by the backend service.

Change-Id: I9715bf8d9f2bf2a5fd8e04607c0d389da1df81b9
Closes-Bug: #1262328

commit_message:
delete bash_completion in subcommand

There are two "completion" in the subcommand table: bash-completion
and bash_completion. but "bash_completion" is not in help information
and it is repeated with "bash-completion", so delete it.

Change-Id: Ic392bb22bcba52c76a7031f8fb6a8f4621d5e151
Closes-Bug: #1670123

Function 'tempest.test.attr()' has moved to 'tempest.lib.decorators
.attr()' in Pike and will be removed in a future version.
This patch replaces the 'tempest.test.attr()' with the 'tempest.lib
.decorators.attr().'

Change-Id: Ic9254d4a214a05bfb930e6abd4ce6c4988311ea0

commit_message:
Replace test.attr with decorators.attr

Function 'tempest.test.attr()' has moved to 'tempest.lib.decorators
.attr()' in Pike and will be removed in a future version.
This patch replaces the 'tempest.test.attr()' with the 'tempest.lib
.decorators.attr().'

Change-Id: Ic9254d4a214a05bfb930e6abd4ce6c4988311ea0

Example environment file to use L2GW Neutron Driver with ODL

  Agent service is disabled and service_provider is configured
  to point to networking-odl

commit_message:
Add supplemental node provisioner

Add ability to deploy a supplemental node along with undercloud
and overcloud nodes by the libvirt/setup role(s) along with
basic ability to deploy TLS everywhere.

- Update tripleo-inventory role to allow for configuring
supplmental node host access
- Update common role defaults with required vars
- Update quickstart.sh to support fake HA IPA deployment
- Update general_config/ipa.yml with relevant vars
- Add nodes/1ctlr_1comp_1supp.yml for supplmental node deployment
- Add release note

Depends-On: I53323511aabf0d616805efab6edde4acc7bedf11
Related-Bug: 1662923

Change-Id: I3f18e26d0e40942c7c54c07b644ee1209fb89c83

commit_message:
Add 'propose' job for openstack-ansible-tests

The openstack/openstack-ansible-tests repository holds various test
files which are duplicated in every openstack-ansible project. Files
are often end up out of sync so we add a new 'propose' job in order
to try and keep all these files in sync.

Change-Id: Ic46cf859c8a6e0eae2576cb11e2798f49ce87b23

commit_message:
Generalize api_interface_address variable usage

Useful api_interface_address variable has been define here:
https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/group_vars/all.yml#L57
In order to simplify codebase we must use it as much as possible.

Change-Id: I18fec19bf69e05a22a4142a9cd1165eccd022455

commit_message:
Disable mongodb by default

It's not used by any service that we enable by default. So instead, I
added it to the environment that enables the services that use it.

Change-Id: Id2e6550fb7c319fc52469644ea022cf35757e0ce

commit_message:
v2: Remove type_local hack

It was a workaround for horizon.
Newton and later version of horizon doesn't need it
as it natively supports MidoNet network types.

Closes-Bug: #1690732
Change-Id: I9d5841e78adcb0ed626abbff5e12f2225d258d30

commit_message:
Using fixtures instead of deprecated mockpatch module

This module mockpatch of oslotest[1] is deprecated since version 1.13
and may be removed in version 2.0. Use fixtures.Mock* classes instead[2]

[1]OpenStack Testing Framework and Utilities
[2]https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/api/oslotest.mockpatch.html#module-oslotest.mockpatch

Change-Id: Ia0ae1fd162b048e431d202633244c14706436e31

commit_message:
Bump sqlalchemy-migrate to new release 0.11.0

The upper constraints for sqlalchemy-migrate have already been
bumped for 0.11.0 in I6acfd3ae0f73957924bea840144ad9cba376ef12.

Update global requirements to use latest release that includes
change I0210d56a6e85f03c44cea027f50863faaf050c1d which helps to
fix the bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1546441.

Change-Id: I88bf46cdce4e778659eefaf15982d8f2db62c555

commit_message:
Don't use explicit testr

pbr auto-detects which test runner it should use[1]. So just call the
usual "python setup.py test" and let pbr do the work.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/pbr/#testing

Change-Id: Id35799f3210a6f0ba09dc8dcc10f8eca6abc444b

commit_message:
Allow BGP DB test to run with non ml2 core plugins

The DB tests are located under BgpTest class which inherits
Ml2PluginV2TestCase, thus makes it harder to reuse existing DB tests to
run in the context of different core plugins.

Change-Id: I320e0124719cb03632fa86fbc49812c0fea35e4f

Remove tree config parser from plugins

with plugins using the node-graph directly.  This can be squashed into
Ib7fd394139f5a70fa64f61e8bbd1d6bbca470bcf but is separated for review
clarity.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 11866, 'name': 'Naoto Nishizono', 'email': 'nishizono.naoto@po.ntt-tx.co.jp', 'username': 'Naoto_Nishizono'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18838, 'name': 'Paul Dardeau', 'email': 'paul.dardeau@intel.com', 'username': 'pdardeau'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2017-02-23 18:14:29.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/ring/__init__.py', 'test/unit/common/test_storage_policy.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_ring.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'swift/common/ring/ring.py'], 'message': 'CompositeRing Support

This is an early patch to support composite ring in Swift.
This was talked in Austin Hackathon at 2015 summer and I got the idea
from Sam.

Primary usages of this composite ring are here (for now):

- To be easier to control *object* replica placement by operator
- Affinity (global cluster) support at *account/container*

This patch includes the capability of first usage but second is still in
the future work yet.

This patch introduces a new mechanism called CompositeRing which enables
each swift process to load the composite Ring instance.

In general, no changes for swift-ring-builder (it may be good to add
some helpers to validate something for builder) and operators can make
rings as well as past work, and can deploy into their own clusters.

To turn on this feature, operators need to prepare the rings generated by
swift-ring-builder and deploy all rings into Swift cluster and set
"composite_ring_num" at the policy section in swift.conf.

E.g. if an operator has 2 rings and wants to deploy composite ring with
them as policy-1, operator deploy the rings to cluster as
object-1.0.ring.gz and object-1.1.ring.gz. And then, set
"composite_ring_num = 2" in policy-1 section in his swift.conf.

When this feature turned on, each swift process will load all deployed
rings (i.e. object-1.0.ring.gz and object-1.1.ring.gz in example case)
and handle them as if it is one ring instance.

The replica count in CompositeRing will be the sum of replicas of all rings
deployed. Primaries also a set of primaries in all rings.

Co-Authored-By: Naoto Nishizono <nishizono.naoto@po.ntts.co.jp>

Doc-Impact

Change-Id: I80ef36d3ac4d4b7c97a1d034b7fc8e0dc2214d16
'}]
commit_message:
CompositeRing Support

This is an early patch to support composite ring in Swift.
This was talked in Austin Hackathon at 2015 summer and I got the idea
from Sam.

Primary usages of this composite ring are here (for now):

- To be easier to control *object* replica placement by operator
- Affinity (global cluster) support at *account/container*

This patch includes the capability of first usage but second is still in
the future work yet.

This patch introduces a new mechanism called CompositeRing which enables
each swift process to load the composite Ring instance.

In general, no changes for swift-ring-builder (it may be good to add
some helpers to validate something for builder) and operators can make
rings as well as past work, and can deploy into their own clusters.

To turn on this feature, operators need to prepare the rings generated by
swift-ring-builder and deploy all rings into Swift cluster and set
"composite_ring_num" at the policy section in swift.conf.

E.g. if an operator has 2 rings and wants to deploy composite ring with
them as policy-1, operator deploy the rings to cluster as
object-1.0.ring.gz and object-1.1.ring.gz. And then, set
"composite_ring_num = 2" in policy-1 section in his swift.conf.

When this feature turned on, each swift process will load all deployed
rings (i.e. object-1.0.ring.gz and object-1.1.ring.gz in example case)
and handle them as if it is one ring instance.

The replica count in CompositeRing will be the sum of replicas of all rings
deployed. Primaries also a set of primaries in all rings.

Co-Authored-By: Naoto Nishizono <nishizono.naoto@po.ntts.co.jp>

Doc-Impact

Change-Id: I80ef36d3ac4d4b7c97a1d034b7fc8e0dc2214d16

revisions:

cinder-volume will convert the disk locally when boot image from volume
with create new volume. whereas the container only have 10G space in
default, cinder-volume will complain that no space if image is large.

This patch mount cinder volume for cinder-volume and cinder-backup all
the time.

Change-Id: I8c68ea49374dc67839699b81e345cfc390a01fe3
Close-Bug: #1692485

'}]
commit_message:
Mount cinder volume for cinder-volume and cinder-backup all the time

cinder-volume will convert the disk locally when boot image from volume
with create new volume. whereas the container only have 10G space in
default, cinder-volume will complain that no space if image is large.

This patch mount cinder volume for cinder-volume and cinder-backup all
the time.

Change-Id: I8c68ea49374dc67839699b81e345cfc390a01fe3
Close-Bug: #1692485
(cherry picked from commit e5ee448ea8b9ea1651dfa7fe45a7f44b70e4caa1)

commit_message:
Add role to deploy FreeIPA

New role has the ability to deploy a FreeIPA server

- Update undercloud-deploy role to check hostvars for freeipa
  related vars set during role execution
- Update novajoin_prep.sh to set IPA server as dns server

Closes-Bug: 1662923

Change-Id: I53323511aabf0d616805efab6edde4acc7bedf11

commit_message:
Disable the requirements job for networking-arista stable/mitaka-hpb

networking-arista has additional requirements in the stable/mitaka*
branches since it was not gated on requirements until Newton. Changes proposed
for the mitaka-hpb branch will pull requirements from the g-r master.

Change-Id: I9f2df49a361b0009372f80bcba3538afaf227794

commit_message:
new project: tc-as-a-service

This patch adds a new project Traffic Control as a Service (TCaaS). The
project provides extension to existing Neutron API to manage TC rules
and implements an agent to enforce those rules.

Change-Id: Iac7e3b6afe9affef05dbb2bf4bf9c2da64e4bedb

subject: Remove Cinder block device driver job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-21 16:15:53.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove Cinder block device driver job

The Cinder block device driver was deprecated in Ocata and is no longer
being supported. It will be removed completely in Queens.

Due to lack of support for minimum required functionality, the tests
for this driver always fail. Rather than waste infra resources running
these tests even though they will never pass, and the failures will
not be fixed, we should just remove these tests.

Change-Id: Iacd4e269374e979df75b1e7dcf2eebac9366eccd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Cinder block device driver job

The Cinder block device driver was deprecated in Ocata and is no longer
being supported. It will be removed completely in Queens.

Due to lack of support for minimum required functionality, the tests
for this driver always fail. Rather than waste infra resources running
these tests even though they will never pass, and the failures will
not be fixed, we should just remove these tests.

Change-Id: Iacd4e269374e979df75b1e7dcf2eebac9366eccd

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-22 12:19:32.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_df_local_controller.py', 'dragonflow/controller/df_local_controller.py'], 'message': 'Check if the object has been deleted

When calling db_store2.get_one(), it should check
if this method returns None which means the object
cannot be found.

This logic has been implemented in other methods
except this one.

The root cause of deleting one object twice needs
further investigation.

Change-Id: Icbe320170751e5771ca1426d10abfe3ae6cf8846
Closes-Bug: #1691904
'}]
commit_message:
Check if the object has been deleted

When calling db_store2.get_one(), it should check
if this method returns None which means the object
cannot be found.

This logic has been implemented in other methods
except this one.

The root cause of deleting one object twice needs
further investigation.

Change-Id: Icbe320170751e5771ca1426d10abfe3ae6cf8846
Closes-Bug: #1691904

commit_message:
Add dracut-regenerate elements

This new element will allow to regenerate dracut
on the produced images, to enable different modules. It
relies on a yaml blob to specify modules and packages
needed. It defaults to installing lvm and crypt.

Change-Id: I292fb70cde41ee6053b7b81a67931bcdaaa6d664

commit_message:
Remove test_update_server_from_auto_to_manual

test_update_server_from_auto_to_manual will be covered in
either test_rebuild_server_with_manual_disk_config or
test_rebuild_server_with_auto_disk_config, so this is
to remove it for reducing the total run time.

test_update_server_from_auto_to_manual is not used in
defcore, so it is safe to remove it.

Change-Id: I8bc6b404fcbbbe4b5abe123543e457cb8d5e6578

commit_message:
Add supported conntrack_driver option to devstack plugin

Now that we supported new netlink_conntrack driver option
beside current conntrack driver.
We use conntrack driver as default as usual. We can config
this option to netlink_conntrack in lage scale system in
order to update firewall more faster.

Change-Id: Ica235f731040614e7d6a07c3c3dba6450789e7ae
(cherry picked from commit 46cf23aabf7c1f00c146b815e6ed98e4ddfd9187)

subject: Revert "Remove Babel as a runtime requirement"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-23 04:26:09.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Revert "Remove Babel as a runtime requirement"

This reverts commit 0658992b0b9bb8a9ad71ddf962d89d3ede27b95e.

The reverted commit moves Babel to test-requirements.txt
but Babel is a run-time requirement as _gettextutils imports Babel.
As a result, oslo_i18n 3.15.2 cannot be imported.

Closes-Bug: #1692773
Change-Id: I97ae11925462b2e21ede5d9573e90ee21fb7e4d2
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove Babel as a runtime requirement"

This reverts commit 0658992b0b9bb8a9ad71ddf962d89d3ede27b95e.

The reverted commit moves Babel to test-requirements.txt
but Babel is a run-time requirement as _gettextutils imports Babel.
As a result, oslo_i18n 3.15.2 cannot be imported.

Closes-Bug: #1692773
Change-Id: I97ae11925462b2e21ede5d9573e90ee21fb7e4d2

subject: Fix domain_id/domain_name typo
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-08 10:44:10.000000000', 'files': ['muranoclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Fix domain_id/domain_name typo

Using openrc downloaded from dashboard, auth against keyston v3 failed.
The environ supplied OS_{PROJECT,USER}_DOMAIN_NAME were not used.
Keystone logs showed that string 'default' is used as id (not as name).

Closes-bug: #1600181

Change-Id: Iddfb45690a4fed2c042ee53b1e691b0802da3b8a
Signed-off-by: Justin Cinkelj <justin.cinkelj@xlab.si>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix domain_id/domain_name typo

Using openrc downloaded from dashboard, auth against keyston v3 failed.
The environ supplied OS_{PROJECT,USER}_DOMAIN_NAME were not used.
Keystone logs showed that string 'default' is used as id (not as name).

Closes-bug: #1600181

Change-Id: Iddfb45690a4fed2c042ee53b1e691b0802da3b8a
Signed-off-by: Justin Cinkelj <justin.cinkelj@xlab.si>

commit_message:
Fixing environment template deployment in multiregion

Environment templates needs to have the region in the definition
to be able to transform into an environment and deployed
in an environment template. This patch solves that.

Change-Id: Ifc2bceeda6595fddc8067e977e7801e72c0ad718
Closes-Bug: #1597715

subject: Add openstackclient dependency back
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-28 12:25:52.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add openstackclient dependency back

Change I4b998cea5c901436e3934d77f2d3a227eb5d1d9d used osc-lib
to replace OpenStackClient(OSC), and removed OSC from
requirement.txt. This will cause this plugin client CLI unable
to work until users install OSC themselves.

osc-lib aims to provide common utils that all OSC plugins may
use. At some point, probably uses will not want OSC automagically
pulled in, and osc-lib allows that. But for those who want to
install OSC automatically, we should add the dependency back.

Change-Id: I3d7118b982fd6cde7567ac442d43f8b48cd0ccef
'}]
commit_message:
Add openstackclient dependency back

Change I4b998cea5c901436e3934d77f2d3a227eb5d1d9d used osc-lib
to replace OpenStackClient(OSC), and removed OSC from
requirement.txt. This will cause this plugin client CLI unable
to work until users install OSC themselves.

osc-lib aims to provide common utils that all OSC plugins may
use. At some point, probably uses will not want OSC automagically
pulled in, and osc-lib allows that. But for those who want to
install OSC automatically, we should add the dependency back.

Change-Id: I3d7118b982fd6cde7567ac442d43f8b48cd0ccef

Fedora/CentOS/RHEL installations still contains Python 2.6 as default.

commit_message:
Workaround for murano-agent install with py2.6

Fedora/CentOS/RHEL installations still contains Python 2.6 as default.
However, murano need Python 2.7 to operate with murano-agent. Workaround
for this case was added.

Co-Authored-By: Nikolay Starodubtsev <starodubcevna@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I033ac8fa459e6c130610163278d10679710ffa7c
Targets-blueprint: cloud-init-deployable-agent

commit_message:
Catch exception.OverQuota when create image for volume backed instance

When create image for a volume backed instance, nova will
create snapshots for all volumes attached to the instance
in Cinder, and if quota exceed in Cinder, HTTP 500 will
raise, we should capture this error and raise 403.

Change-Id: Ic62478e22a7477cfaefac3e63c383082d66bd635
Closes-Bug: #1689284

commit_message:
Deprecate external_network_bridge and gateway_external_network_id options

"external_network_bridge" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated for removal.
It will be removed in Ocata.
Option "gateway_external_network_id" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated
for removal. It will be removed in Ocata.

Closes-Bug: #1692776

commit_message:
Change to "monasca-read-only-user" for read only tests

"monasca-read-only-user" is a better name instead of "anotherrole"
for read only tempest tests. It's also set by default in
api-config.conf
Also change test.attr() to decorators.attr() in tempest tests
because of the deprecation warning.

Change-Id: I05427147e2755bdc6fde483a145258f6fb695356

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-05-15 06:29:06.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/volume/test_volumes_negative.py'], 'message': '[Negative] Create a volume with invalid availability zone

Usually, we create a volume without specifying the availability zone parameter,
as a result, cinder uses the default_availability_zone parameter in cinder.conf.
This test verifies volume creation with invalid availability zone.

Change-Id: I5a055e86a126b815899f52fbd0abe3c589050e0e
'}]
commit_message:
[Negative] Create a volume with invalid availability zone

Usually, we create a volume without specifying the availability zone parameter,
as a result, cinder uses the default_availability_zone parameter in cinder.conf.
This test verifies volume creation with invalid availability zone.

Change-Id: I5a055e86a126b815899f52fbd0abe3c589050e0e
